scenes.time: Early evening, a few days after the discovery of the Matrix
scenes.location: An abandoned warehouse in the industrial sector of Zion
scenes.description: The scene is set in a dimly lit, damp warehouse. The air is tense with the possibility of a sudden attack. The characters are surrounded by stacks of rusted metal and decaying boxes.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A former programmer turned savior, Neo has a calm and determined demeanor. He possesses exceptional martial arts abilities and the power to manipulate the Matrix.
characters.position: Standing near the center of the warehouse, alert and ready for action.
characters.states: Concerned but resolute, he is focused on uncovering the truth.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and warrior, Trinity is fiercely loyal to Neo and Morpheus. She is an excellent fighter and strategist.
characters.position: Close to Neo, her back to a stack of boxes, handgun at the ready.
characters.states: Wary and prepared, she is ready to spring into action at any moment.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A treacherous member of the resistance, Cypher is cunning and self-serving. He has been attempting to sell out Morpheus to the Agents.
characters.position: In a shadowy corner, attempting to remain hidden.
characters.states: Nervous and on edge, he is trying to gauge the situation.

actions.action: With a focused gaze, Neo slowly scans the warehouse, his senses heightened for any sign of the enemy.
actions.dialogue: “We need to find Morpheus before Cypher does. Keep your eyes open, Trinity.”

actions.action: Trinity nods and whispers back, her voice steady, “I'm on it. Let's move carefully, we don't want to alert him.”
actions.dialogue: None

actions.action: Cypher, hidden in the shadows, watches the pair with a mix of fear and calculation, his hand resting on a concealed weapon.
actions.dialogue: “They're getting too close. I need to make a move soon,” he whispers to himself.

scenes.plot: The scene unfolds as Neo and Trinity search for Morpheus, who is in danger of being betrayed by Cypher. The tension rises as they get closer to uncovering his treachery, and Cypher plans his next move to escape detection.

chunk.text:
{
    "title": "The Matrix",
    "characters": [
        "Agent Smith",
        "Switch",
        "Apoc",
        "Neo",
        "Cypher",
        "Agent Brown",
        "Choi (as Marc Gray)",
        "Trinity",
        "Oracle",
        "Agent Jones",
        "Mouse",
        "Rhineheart",
        "Dozer",
        "Morpheus",
        "Tank"
    ],
    "dialogues": {
        "Agent": "
[1]			Lieutenant? 
[2]			Lieutenant, you were given 			specific orders --  
[3]			The orders were for your protection. 	The Lieutenant laughs. 
[4]			No, Lieutenant, your men are dead. 
[5]			Did you get anything from the 			room? 
[6]			Their next target. The name is 			Neo. 	The handset of the pay phone lays on the ground, 	separated in the crash like a severed limb. 
[7]			We'll need a search running. 
[8]			It's already begun. 	We are SUCKED TOWARDS the mouthpiece of the phone, CLOSER 	and CLOSER, UNTIL the smooth gray plastic spreads out 	like a horizon and the small HOLES WIDEN until we fall 	through one --  	Swallowed by the darkness that becomes --  	A computer screen. 	We are on-line, inside a chat room called "The Matrix. " 	It is an exklusive web-site where hackers hang out. 
[9]			As you can see, we've had our eye 			on you for some time now, Mr. 			Anderson. 	He opens the file. Paper rattle marks the silence as he 	flips several pages. Neo cannot tell if he is looking at 	the file or at him. 
[10]			It seems that you have been living 			two lives. In one life, you are 			Thomas A. Anderson, program writer 			for a respectable software 			company. You have a social 			security number, you pay your 			taxes and you help your land lady 			carry out her garbage. 	The pages continue to turn. 
[11]			The other life is lived in 			computers where you go by the 			hacker alias Neo, and are guilty 			of virtually every computer crime 			we have a law for, including the 			unauthorized use of the D. M. V. 			system for the removal of 			automobile boots. 	Neo feels himself sinking into a pit of shit. 
[12]			One of these,lives has a future. 			One of them does not. 	He closes the file. 
[13]			I'm going to be as forthcoming as 			I can be, Mr. Anderson. You are 			here because we need your help. 	He removes his sunglasses; his eyes are an unnatural ice- 	blue. 
[14]			We know that you have been 			contacted by a certain individual. 			A man who calls himself Morpheus. 			Whatever you think you know about 			this man is irrelevant to the fact 			that he is wanted for acts of 			terrorism in more countries than 			any other man in the world. He is 			considered by many authorities to 			be the most dangerous man alive. 	He leans closer. 
[15]			My colleagues believe that I am 			wasting my time with you, but I 			believe you want to do the right 			thing. It is obvious that you are 			an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, 			and that you are interested in the 			future. That is why I believe you 			are ready to put your past 			mistakes behind you and get on 			with your life. 	Neo tries to match his stare. 
[16]			We are willing to wipe the slate 			clean, to give you a fresh start 			and all we are asking in return is 			your cooperation in bringing a 			known terrorist to justice. 	Neo nods to himself. 
[17]			You disappoint me, Mr. Anderson. 
[18]			The irony of your situation is 			that you have no choice. 
[19]			And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what 			good is a phone call iy you are 			unable to speak? 	The question unnerves Neo and strangely, he begins to 	feel the muscles in his jaw tighten. 	The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion 	grow into panic. 	Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly 	seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his 	mouth is gone. 	Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents 	restrain him holding him in the chair. 
[20]			You are going to help us, Mr. 			Anderson, whether you want to or 			not. 	Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt. 	From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a 	long, fiber-optic wire tap. 	Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over 	his exposed abdomen. Horrified, he watches as the 	electronic device animates, become an organic creature 	that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm. 	Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into 	Neo's navel. He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature 	which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord --  	Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it 	worms its way inside. 
[21]			Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan? 	Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his 	teeth. 
[22]			Then we have a deal? 
[23]			Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan. 	Cypher takes a deep drink of wine. 
[24]			Access codes to Zion. 
[25]			Morpheus. 
[26]			Eighth floor. They're on the 			eighth floor. 
[27]			Eighth floor! Move! 
[28]			Where are they? 
[29]			Are orders that hard to follow? 			I'll say it again. Morpheus must 			be taken alive. Understand? 
[30]			How like a rodent. 
[31]			We have them now.

scenes.time: Early evening, a few days after Neo's encounter with Oracle
scenes.location: A hidden underground meeting room in Zion
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense as Neo and Trinity uncover a plot led by Cypher to betray Zion. The room is dimly lit with flickering overhead lights, filled with a sense of urgency and danger.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A cyberpunk hacker turned savior with exceptional combat skills and a deep understanding of the Matrix. He is determined and wise, seeking the truth about his destiny.
characters.position: Standing at the head of the table, his gaze fixed on the evidence of betrayal.
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to take action.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A fierce warrior and loyal follower of Morpheus, now Neo's love interest. She is brave, intelligent, and unwavering in her belief in Zion.
characters.position: Leaning against a wall, her eyes scanning the room for any signs of threat.
characters.states: Calm yet ready to spring into action at any moment.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A former Zion warrior turned traitor, seeking asylum with the Agents. He is cunning, self-serving, and矛盾 (conflicted).
characters.position: Sitting at the far end of the table, his face obscured in shadows.
characters.states: Appearing relaxed, but with an undercurrent of tension.

actions.action: With a stern voice, Neo points at the evidence on the table, revealing Cypher's plans to the group.
actions.dialogue: “This is not just a betrayal of Zion, it's a betrayal of our entire existence. We can't let this happen.”

actions.action: Drawing her gun, Trinity moves to stand beside Neo, ready to support him.
actions.dialogue: “We need to stop him, now. Morpheus trusted us, we can't let him down.”

actions.action: With a chilling smile, Cypher stands up, his hands raised in a conciliatory gesture.
actions.dialogue: “You don't understand. This is the only way. The Matrix offers a better life. Join me, and end this futile struggle.”

scenes.plot: The scene sets the stage for a confrontation between Neo and Trinity against Cypher's betrayal. It highlights the characters' differing motivations and the urgency of their actions in the face of a threat to Zion.

scenes.event: Showdown Between Neo and Agent Smith
scenes.time: Early morning, several months after the rescue of Morpheus
scenes.location: An abandoned industrial complex outside the Matrix
scenes.description: A desolate and dimly lit scene, with rusted machinery and hanging chains. The air is filled with tension as a fierce battle is about to unfold between Neo and Agent Smith.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The protagonist, a.k.a. The One, with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. He is determined and possesses exceptional martial arts skills.
characters.position: Standing in the center of the complex, ready for the confrontation
characters.states: Calm and focused, ready to use his abilities to protect his allies

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A powerful and relentless Agent of the Matrix, intent on destroying the resistance. He can clone himself and possess others.
characters.position: Appearing suddenly from the shadows, ready to engage Neo
characters.states: Cruel and mocking, confident in his superiority

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled warrior and hacker, deeply committed to the resistance. She is brave and resourceful, with a strong connection to Neo.
characters.position: Watching from a distance, ready to provide support if needed
characters.states: Worried for Neo, but trustful in his abilities

actions.action: With a serene expression, Neo assumes a defensive stance, ready to counter any attack from Smith
actions.dialogue: “You can't beat me, Smith. I'm not just another program. I'm The One.”

actions.action: Smith laughs mockingly and multiple clones of himself appear, surrounding Neo
actions.dialogue: “Ah, The One. How will you save yourself this time?”

actions.action: From her vantage point, Trinity monitors the situation, her hand on a hidden weapon
actions.dialogue: “Neo, be careful! Don't let him get to you!”

actions.action: With a swift movement, Neo dodges an attack and delivers a powerful kick to one of the clones
actions.dialogue: “I won't. We're going to end this, Smith.”

scenes.plot: The scene sets the stage for the climactic battle between Neo and Agent Smith, with Trinity in a supporting role, ready to intervene if necessary. The tension is high as the fate of the resistance hangs in the balance.

chunk.text:
[32]			So, we meet at last. 
[33]			Smith. I am Agent Smith. 
[34]			I've been waiting for this noment. 	Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a 	jaw-breaking right. 
[35]			You can't win. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[36]			Take him. 	Cops swarm over Morpheus. 
[37]			The others were lost. 
[38]			You've taken care of Reagan? 	Agent Jones nods. 
[39]			Then the others do not matter. 
[40]			There is a problem. Reagan has 			failed to secure the hardware. 	Agent Smith stares out the window. 
[41]			Never send a human to do a 			machine's job. 
[42]			But if Reagan has failed, why 			haven't they pulled the plug? 
[43]			Haven't you learned by now, that 			it is impossible to understand why 			they do the things they do? 	He turns. 
[44]			Continue as planned. Trace his 			signal to locate their position 			and deploy an extermination unit. 	Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, stripped to the waist. 	He is bleeding from numerous wounds and is pumped full of 	serum, alternately shivering and sweating. He is hooked 	up to various monitors with white disk electrodes. 	Agent Brown begins running a trace program. 
[45]			Have you ever stood and stared at 			it, Morpheus? Marveled at its 			beauty. Its genius. Billions of 			people just living out their 			lives. . . oblivious. 	Agent Brown sucks a serum from a glass vial, filling a 	hypodermic needle. 
[46]			Did you know that the first Matrix 			was designed to be a perfect human 			world? Where none suffered, where 			everyone would be happy. It was a 			disaster. No one would accept the 			program. Entire crops were lost. 	Agent Brown jams the needle into Morpheus' shoulder, and 	plunges down. 
[47]			Some believed we lacked the 			programming language to describe 			your perfect world. But I believe 			that, as a species, human beings 			define their reality through 			suffering and misery. 	Agent Brown studies the screens as the life signs react 	violently to the injection. 
[48]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[49]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[50]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[51]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[52]			The future is our world, Morpheus. 			The future is our time. 
[53]			I'd like to share a revelation 			that I've had during my time here. 			It came to me when I tried to 			classify your species. I've 			realized that you are not actually 			mammals. 	The life signs continue their chaotic patterns. 
[54]			Every mammal on this planet 			instinctively develops a natural 			equilibrium with the surrounding 			environment. But you humans do 			not. You move to an area and you 			multiply and multiply until every 			natural resource is consumed and 			the only way you can survive is to 			spread to another area. 	He leans forward. 
[55]			There is another organism on this 			planet that follows the same 			pattern. Do you know what it is? 			A virus. 	He smiles. 
[56]			Human beings are a disease, a 			cancer of this planet. You are a 			plague. And we are. . . the cure. 
[57]			Why isn't the serum working? 
[58]			Perhaps we are asking the wrong 			questions. 
[59]			Or he doesn't know. 
[60]			Of course he knows. He's 			resisting. 
[61]			How? 
[62]			I don't know. If I knew. . . 	Agent Smith hides his knotting fist. He is becoming 	angry. It is something that isn't supposed to happen to 	agents. 
[63]			Leave me with him. 	Agent Brown and Jones look at each other. 
[64]			Now! 
[65]			Can you hear me, Morpheus? I'm 			going to be honest with you. 	He removes his earphone, letting it dangle over his 	shoulder. 
[66]			I hate this place. This zoo. 			This prison. This reality, 			whatever you want to call it, I 			can't stand it any longer. It's 			the smell, if there is such a 			thing. I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[67]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[68]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[69]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[70]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[71]			What were you doing?

scenes.time: 2 years after the Matrix was reloaded, 10:00 PM
scenes.location: An abandoned factory in the industrial sector of the Matrix
scenes.description: A dimly lit, desolate factory filled with rusted machinery. The air is thick with a fine dust that glimmers in the faint light. The sound of dripping water echoes through the vast space.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, a man with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. He has a strong sense of duty and a deep love for Trinity.
characters.position: Standing in the center of the factory, surrounded by the remains of old equipment.
characters.states: Concerned, focused, and determined.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A rogue agent with a vendetta against humanity. Now forced to work with Neo to save the Matrix and Zion.
characters.position: Leaning against a wall, observing Neo with a critical eye.
characters.states: Cynical, watchful, and reluctantly cooperative.

actions.action: Activates his cybernetic eyes, scanning the area for any sign of Trinity or the unknown threat.
actions.dialogue: “We don’t have much time, Smith. Trinity’s signal is fading. We need to find her before it’s too late.”

actions.action: Pushes off from the wall, a hint of urgency in his movements as he starts to search the factory.
actions.dialogue: “I don’t care about your girlfriend, Anderson. But I won’t let this new enemy destroy the balance. It’s in my interest to stop them too.”

actions.action: Pauses, then nods in agreement before leading the way deeper into the factory.
actions.dialogue: “Then let’s get moving. We need to find Trinity and get to the bottom of this.”

scenes.plot: In this scene, the unlikely alliance between Neo and Agent Smith is tested as they search for Trinity in an abandoned factory. The tension between them is palpable, but they are united in their goal to uncover and stop the new threat to the Matrix and Zion.

chunk.text:
Agent Smith recovers, replacing his ear piece. 
[72]			You don't know. 
[73]			Know what? 	Agent Smith listens to his earphone, not believing what 	he is hearing. 
[74]			I think they're trying to save 			him. 
[75]			Lower level --  
[76]			They are actually attacking. 
[77]			Find them and destroy them! 	Agent Jones nods and touches his ear piece. 
[78]			Only human. . . 	Suddenly Agent Jones stops. Something is wrong. He 	scans the roof. Trinity is gone. 	Immediately, he whirls around and turns straight into the 	muzzle of her . 45 --  	Jammed right into his head. 
[79]			Remain at your posts. 
[80]			You will do as you are ordered! 
[81]			No. 	The GUN jumps and BULLETS EXPLODE through the WINDOW in a 	cacophony of CRASHING GLASS --  	As the Agents go for their weapons. 	But Neo is too close, the . 50 CALIBER too fast and 	BULLETS are everywhere, perforating the room. 	Agent Smith is hit first, his body jack-knifing back, 	blood arcing out with a sudden flash of light --  	Then Agent Brown, his GUN still FIRING as his body falls. 	And finally Agent Jones. 	Neo stares at Morpheus, trying to will him into action. 
[82]			Nooo! 	He FIRES, sweeping across the sheetrocked wall in a 	perfect line. 	For an instant, we see the BULLETS SHRED, PUNCTURING the 	WALL, searing through the wet air with jet trails of 	chalk. 	And as Morpheus starts to dive for the window, a bullet 	buries itself in his leg --  	Knocking him off balance. 
[83]			The trace was completed. 
[84]			We have their position. 
[85]			The extermination unit is in 			place. 
[86]			Order the strike. 	Agent Smith can't stand listening to them. He moves to 	the edge of the building, looking out at the surrounding 	city. 
[87]			They're not out yet. 
[88]			You're empty. 	Neo pulls the TRIGGER. CLICK. 
[89]			You can't win. 
[90]			Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson? 	Agent Smith grabs Neo in a choke-hold, forcing him to 	look down the tracks, the train's headlight burning a 	hole in the darkness. 
[91]			That is the sound of 			inevitability. 	Neo sees it coming and he starts to fight. 
[92]			It is the sound of your death. 	There is another METAL SCREECH, MUCH LOUDER, closer, as 	Agent Smith tightens his hold. Neo is unable to breathe. 
[93]			Goodbye, Mr. Anderson. 	The TRAIN ROARS at them, swallowing Agent Smith's words. 	The veins bulge in Neo's head, as he grits through the 	pain. 	He is not ready to die. 
[94]			Check him. 
[95]			He's gone. 	Agent Smith smiles, standing over him. 
[96]			I told you, you couldn't win. 
[97]			Nooooo! 	Agent Smith pounds on the elevator door. ",

[5]			Did you get anything from the 			room? 
[6]			We'll need a search running. 
[7]			As you can see, we've had our eye 			on you for some time now, Mr. 			Anderson. 	He opens the file. Paper rattle marks the silence as he 	flips several pages. Neo cannot tell if he is looking at 	the file or at him. 
[8]			It seems that you have been living 			two lives. In one life, you are 			Thomas A. Anderson, program writer 			for a respectable software 			company. You have a social 			security number, you pay your 			taxes and you help your land lady 			carry out her garbage. 	The pages continue to turn. 
[9]			The other life is lived in 			computers where you go by the 			hacker alias Neo, and are guilty 			of virtually every computer crime 			we have a law for, including the 			unauthorized use of the D. M. V. 			system for the removal of 			automobile boots. 	Neo feels himself sinking into a pit of shit. 
[10]			One of these,lives has a future. 			One of them does not. 	He closes the file. 
[11]			I'm going to be as forthcoming as 			I can be, Mr. Anderson. You are 			here because we need your help. 	He removes his sunglasses; his eyes are an unnatural ice- 	blue. 
[12]			We know that you have been 			contacted by a certain individual. 			A man who calls himself Morpheus. 			Whatever you think you know about 			this man is irrelevant to the fact 			that he is wanted for acts of 			terrorism in more countries than 			any other man in the world. He is 			considered by many authorities to 			be the most dangerous man alive. 	He leans closer. 
[13]			My colleagues believe that I am 			wasting my time with you, but I 			believe you want to do the right 			thing. It is obvious that you are 			an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, 			and that you are interested in the 			future. That is why I believe you 			are ready to put your past 			mistakes behind you and get on 			with your life. 	Neo tries to match his stare. 
[14]			We are willing to wipe the slate 			clean, to give you a fresh start 			and all we are asking in return is 			your cooperation in bringing a 			known terrorist to justice. 	Neo nods to himself. 
[15]			You disappoint me, Mr. Anderson. 
[16]			The irony of your situation is 			that you have no choice. 
[17]			And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what 			good is a phone call iy you are 			unable to speak?

scenes.time: Midnight, several days after the battle
scenes.location: A dimly lit corridor within the Zion command center
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense and expectant as the truth about the traitor is about to be revealed, with the characters surrounded by the hum of machinery and the glow of terminal screens.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, a determined and resolute leader with unparalleled martial arts skills and an emerging control over the Matrix.
characters.position: Standing at the head of a strategy table, his gaze fixed on the group, ready to address them.
characters.states: Serious and focused, with a hint of concern for the upcoming revelation.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A once trusted member of Zion, now exposed as a traitor, known for his cunning and selfishness, skilled in computer systems and motivated by personal gain.
characters.position: Leaning against a wall, his expression a mix of defiance and unease as he faces the consequences of his actions.
characters.states: Arrogant yet nervous, his treachery laid bare.

actions.action: With a firm voice, Neo points at Cypher, his expression one of resolve as he reveals the truth to the assembly.
actions.dialogue: “Cypher has betrayed us. He's been collaborating with the Agents. We must secure our access codes immediately.”

actions.action: With a sly smile, Cypher attempts to downplay his treachery, his tone dripping with sarcasm and condescension.
actions.dialogue: “You'll never appreciate the luxury of the Matrix, the taste of a good steak. You're destined to remain here, in the dark.”

scenes.plot: This scene sets the stage for the dramatic uncovering of a betrayal within the ranks, as Neo navigates the treacherous actions of Cypher while ensuring the safety of Zion's access codes.

chunk.text:
The question unnerves Neo and strangely, he begins to 	feel the muscles in his jaw tighten. 	The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion 	grow into panic. 	Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly 	seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his 	mouth is gone. 	Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents 	restrain him holding him in the chair. 
[18]			You are going to help us, Mr. 			Anderson, whether you want to or 			not. 	Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt. 	From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a 	long, fiber-optic wire tap. 	Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over 	his exposed abdomen. Horrified, he watches as the 	electronic device animates, become an organic creature 	that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm. 	Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into 	Neo's navel. He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature 	which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord --  	Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it 	worms its way inside. 
[19]			Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan? 	Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his 	teeth. 
[20]			Then we have a deal? 
[21]			Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan. 	Cypher takes a deep drink of wine. 
[22]			Access codes to Zion. 
[23]			Morpheus. 
[24]			Eighth floor. They're on the 			eighth floor. 
[25]			Are orders that hard to follow? 			I'll say it again. Morpheus must 			be taken alive. Understand? 
[26]			How like a rodent. 
[27]			We have them now. 
[28]			So, we meet at last. 
[29]			Smith. I am Agent Smith. 
[30]			I've been waiting for this noment. 	Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a 	jaw-breaking right. 
[31]			You can't win. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[32]			Take him. 	Cops swarm over Morpheus. 
[33]			You've taken care of Reagan? 	Agent Jones nods. 
[34]			Then the others do not matter. 
[35]			Never send a human to do a 			machine's job. 
[36]			Haven't you learned by now, that 			it is impossible to understand why 			they do the things they do? 	He turns. 
[37]			Continue as planned. Trace his 			signal to locate their position 			and deploy an extermination unit. 	Morpheus is handcuffed to a chair, stripped to the waist. 	He is bleeding from numerous wounds and is pumped full of 	serum, alternately shivering and sweating. He is hooked 	up to various monitors with white disk electrodes. 	Agent Brown begins running a trace program. 
[38]			Have you ever stood and stared at 			it, Morpheus? Marveled at its 			beauty. Its genius. Billions of 			people just living out their 			lives. . . oblivious. 	Agent Brown sucks a serum from a glass vial, filling a 	hypodermic needle. 
[39]			Did you know that the first Matrix 			was designed to be a perfect human 			world? Where none suffered, where 			everyone would be happy. It was a 			disaster. No one would accept the 			program. Entire crops were lost. 	Agent Brown jams the needle into Morpheus' shoulder, and 	plunges down. 
[40]			Some believed we lacked the 			programming language to describe 			your perfect world. But I believe 			that, as a species, human beings 			define their reality through 			suffering and misery. 	Agent Brown studies the screens as the life signs react 	violently to the injection. 
[41]			The perfect world was a dream that 			your primitive cerebrum kept 			trying to wake up from. Which is 			why the Matrix was re-designed to 			this:  the peak of your 			civilization. 	He turns from the window. 
[42]			I say 'your civilization' because 			as soon as we start thinking for 			you, it really becomes our 			civilization, which is, of course, 			what this is all about. 	He sits down directly in front of Morpheus. 
[43]			Evolution, Morpheus. Evolution. 	He lifts Morpheus' head. 
[44]			Like the dinosaur. Look out that 			window. You had your time. 	Morpheus stares hard at him, trying hard not to show the 	pain racking his mind. 
[45]			The future is our world, Morpheus. 			The future is our time. 
[46]			I'd like to share a revelation 			that I've had during my time here. 			It came to me when I tried to 			classify your species. I've 			realized that you are not actually 			mammals. 	The life signs continue their chaotic patterns. 
[47]			Every mammal on this planet 			instinctively develops a natural 			equilibrium with the surrounding 			environment. But you humans do 			not. You move to an area and you 			multiply and multiply until every 			natural resource is consumed and 			the only way you can survive is to 			spread to another area. 	He leans forward. 
[48]			There is another organism on this 			planet that follows the same 			pattern. Do you know what it is? 			A virus. 	He smiles. 
[49]			Human beings are a disease, a 			cancer of this planet. You are a 			plague. And we are. . . the cure. 
[50]			Why isn't the serum working? 
[51]			Of course he knows. He's 			resisting. 
[52]			I don't know. If I knew. . . 	Agent Smith hides his knotting fist. He is becoming 	angry. It is something that isn't supposed to happen to 	agents. 
[53]			Leave me with him. 	Agent Brown and Jones look at each other. 
[54]			Now! 
[55]			Can you hear me, Morpheus? I'm 			going to be honest with you. 	He removes his earphone, letting it dangle over his 	shoulder.

scenes.time: After the awakening of Neo, 2 years 11 months into the Matrix
scenes.location: A secret research facility deep within Zion
scenes.description: A high-tech lab with computers humming and scientists bustling, tension fills the air as Agent Smith prepares to launch an attack.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. He is determined and brave, yet still a bit wary of the unknown.
characters.position: Standing by the mainframe, ready to defend the research data.
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to use his abilities if needed.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless and cunning Agent of the Matrix, intent on destroying the resistance and acquiring their secrets.
characters.position: Outside the lab, preparing to breach the security.
characters.states: Calm and collected, with a hint of anticipation for the upcoming confrontation.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and valiant leader of the resistance, deeply committed to the cause of freedom.
characters.position: In the control room, coordinating the defense strategy.
characters.states: Serious and commanding, ensuring the safety of the research.

actions.action: With a deep breath, Neo focuses his mind and slows down time around him, preparing to counter any immediate threat.
actions.dialogue: “This is our fight. We can't let them take this technology.”

actions.action: Agent Smith effortlessly breaks through the lab's defenses, his form blurring as he moves towards the mainframe.
actions.dialogue: “Your efforts are futile, Neo. The technology will be mine.”

actions.action: Morpheus gives a hand signal to the scientists, ordering them to initiate the data transfer to a secure location.
actions.dialogue: “Now! Evacuate the data and get to safety!”

scenes.plot: In this scene, Agent Smith launches an attack on the secret research facility to obtain the technology that can disrupt his regenerative abilities. Neo and Morpheus work together to protect the research, leading to a tense showdown in the heart of the lab.

scenes.time: After the battle, at dawn, on the 3rd day of April, in the year 2199
scenes.location: A dimly lit back alley in the Matrix's urban sprawl
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense and eerie, with a hint of imminent danger. The alley is damp, and the sound of dripping water echoes in the silence.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A disillusioned member of the resistance, skilled in hacking and stealth. His expression is shifty, and his demeanor is calculating.
characters.position: Leaning against a wall, partially hidden in the shadows
characters.states: Suspicious, on edge, and eager to make a deal

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless and cold-hearted Agent of the Matrix, with a strong presence and an aura of control.
characters.position: Standing in the center of the alley, his figure imposing and unyielding
characters.states: Calm, collected, and sizing up Cypher with a hint of amusement

actions.action: Cypher steps forward cautiously, his hands slightly raised to show he means no harm
actions.dialogue: “I have information you want, Smith. Access codes to Zion. But I need something in return...”

actions.action: Smith remains still, his gaze piercing as he studies Cypher intently
actions.dialogue: “And what is it that you desire, Mr. Cypher? A comfortable existence within the Matrix?”

actions.action: Cypher nods slowly, a greedy glint in his eyes
actions.dialogue: “Exactly. And I hear you can make that happen. But I need insurance. I want you to take out Morpheus first.”

scenes.plot: In this pivotal scene, the treacherous intentions of Cypher become clear as he proposes a deal to Agent Smith that could lead to the downfall of Zion. The atmosphere is thick with the weight of the impending betrayal, and the actions and dialogue reflect the cautious dance of two characters with their own agendas.

scenes.event: Showdown at the Secret Hacker Hideout
scenes.time: 10:00 PM, 2nd June, 2199
scenes.location: An abandoned industrial complex outside Zion
scenes.description: A dimly lit, rusted room filled with computer hardware. The air is tense with the hum of machinery and the anticipation of an imminent attack. A group of hackers is working frantically to upload a virus into the Matrix.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, a calm and decisive leader with a sacrificing spirit. Skilled in martial arts and capable of dodging bullets in the Matrix.
characters.position: Stands at the center of the room, overseeing the operation.
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to spring into action.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A brave and loyal warrior, deeply in love with Neo. Proficient in flight and combat, with a strong intuition.
characters.position: Near the entrance, keeping watch for any signs of Agents.
characters.states: Wary and ready to execute a complex hack if needed.

characters.name: Apoc
characters.description: A seasoned warrior with a deep understanding of the Matrix. Serious and strategic, an expert in weapons and tactics.
characters.position: At the computer terminal, assisting the hackers.
characters.states: Concentrated and coordinating the efforts.

actions.action: With a swift movement, Neo grabs a nearby weapon, prepared for any threat.
actions.dialogue: “Keep the upload going. We're running out of time.”

actions.action: Trinity glances at her watch, then whispers into her communicator.
actions.dialogue: “I've got a bad feeling about this. We need to hurry.”

actions.action: Apoc taps on the keyboard with determination, his eyes fixed on the screen.
actions.dialogue: “Almost there. Just a few more seconds!”

scenes.plot: The scene builds up to the critical moment where the virus is about to be uploaded into the Matrix. Tensions are high as the characters work together to ensure the success of their mission while preparing for an imminent attack from the Agents.

chunk.text:
[56]			I hate this place. This zoo. 			This prison. This reality, 			whatever you want to call it, I 			can't stand it any longer. It's 			the smell, if there is such a 			thing. I feel saturated by it. I 			can taste your stink and every 			time I do, I fear that I've 			somehow been infected by it. 	He wipes sweat from Morpheus' forehead, coating the tips 	of his fingers, holding them to Morpheus' nose. 
[57]			Repulsive, isn't it? 	He lifts Morpheus' head, holding it tightly with both 	hands. 
[58]			I must get out of here, I must get 			free. In this mind is tlie key. 			My key. 	Morpheus sneers through his pain. 
[59]			Once Zion is gone, there's no 			need for me to be here. Do you 			understand? I need the codes. I 			have to get inside Zion. You have 			to tell me how. 	He begins squeezing, his fingers gouging into his flesh. 
[60]			Tell me! Tell me! 	The skull is about to shatter when Agents Jones and Brown 	burst into the room. Agent Smith releases Morpheus. 
[61]			Know what? 	Agent Smith listens to his earphone, not believing what 	he is hearing. 
[62]			Find them and destroy them! 	Agent Jones nods and touches his ear piece. 
[63]			No. 	The GUN jumps and BULLETS EXPLODE through the WINDOW in a 	cacophony of CRASHING GLASS --  	As the Agents go for their weapons. 	But Neo is too close, the . 50 CALIBER too fast and 	BULLETS are everywhere, perforating the room. 	Agent Smith is hit first, his body jack-knifing back, 	blood arcing out with a sudden flash of light --  	Then Agent Brown, his GUN still FIRING as his body falls. 	And finally Agent Jones. 	Neo stares at Morpheus, trying to will him into action. 
[64]			Nooo! 	He FIRES, sweeping across the sheetrocked wall in a 	perfect line. 	For an instant, we see the BULLETS SHRED, PUNCTURING the 	WALL, searing through the wet air with jet trails of 	chalk. 	And as Morpheus starts to dive for the window, a bullet 	buries itself in his leg --  	Knocking him off balance. 
[65]			They're not out yet. 
[66]			You're empty. 	Neo pulls the TRIGGER. CLICK. 
[67]			You can't win. 
[68]			Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson? 	Agent Smith grabs Neo in a choke-hold, forcing him to 	look down the tracks, the train's headlight burning a 	hole in the darkness. 
[69]			That is the sound of 			inevitability. 	Neo sees it coming and he starts to fight. 
[70]			It is the sound of your death. 	There is another METAL SCREECH, MUCH LOUDER, closer, as 	Agent Smith tightens his hold. Neo is unable to breathe. 
[71]			Goodbye, Mr. Anderson. 	The TRAIN ROARS at them, swallowing Agent Smith's words. 	The veins bulge in Neo's head, as he grits through the 	pain. 	He is not ready to die. 
[72]			Check him. 
[73]			I told you, you couldn't win. 
[74]			Nooooo! 	Agent Smith pounds on the elevator door. ",

[1]			What if he does? 
[2]			God, I love that sound. 
[3]			Oh God. 	Wearing Tank's operator headgear, Cypher moves among the 	silent bodies. ",

[1]			Come with me. 	Neo stands just as the door at the opposite end opens and 	two police officers rush in, drawing their guns. 	Apoc grabs Neo, muscling him to the nearest exit. There 	is no upcoming station. 	Apoc yanks the emergency brake and the train buckles 	against its own speed. The cops are thrown back. Neo 	slams against the metal rail. 	The doors open onto nothing and just when Neo regains his 	balance, Apoc shoves him backwards --  	He flies out from the train, arms windrilling as he falls 	from, the raised tracks --  	Hurtling towards a busy city street when, out of nowhere, 	a truck races under him and --  	He crashes into a large dumpster-bed filled with empty 	boxes. 
[2]			Almost. 	He and Trinity are working quickly, hardwiring a complex 	system of monitors, modules and drives. 
[3]			That's right. 
[4]			Still nothing. 	Morpheus takes out a cellular phone and dials a number. 
[5]			Targeting. . . almost there. 	An ALARM, on Trinity's monitor ERUPTS. 
[6]			Lock! I got him! 
[7]			Morpheus is right. He's got to be 			the one. 
[8]			No way. Not possible. 
[9]			He won't. 
[10]			What? ! ",

[1] 	It is a studio apartirent that seems overgrown with 	technology. 	Weed-like cables coil everywhere, duct-taped into 	thickets that wind up and around the legs of several 	desks. 	Tabletops are filled with cannibalized equipment that lay 	open like an autopsied corpse. 	We turn towards the center of this rat-nest of 	technology, following the slurping and crunching of 	cereal. We pass an open box of Capln Crunch as we find --  	NEO, a younger man who knows more about living inside a 	computer than living outside one. 
[2]			Fuckin' idiots don't know shit. 	He finishes his cereal and is about to disconnect when an 	anonynous message slices onto the screen. 
[3]			What the hell. . . 
[4]			What do you want, Anthony? 
[5]			You got the money this time? 	He holds up two hundred dollars and Neo opens the door. 	Anthony's girlfriend, DUJOUR, stops in front of Neo. 
[6] 	They watch from the window as the cops, silently, 	robotically, climb into their van. 
[7]			I don't know. I have to work 			tomorrow. 
[8]			Yeah, yeah. Sure, I'll go. 
[9]			How did you know that --  
[10]			Who are you? 
[11]			Trinity? The Trinity? The 			Trinity that cracked the I. R. S. 			Kansas City D-Base?

scenes.time: Early morning, a few days after Neo becomes 'The One'
scenes.location: An abandoned factory within the outskirts of Zion
scenes.description: The factory is dimly lit, with a maze of conveyor belts and rusted machinery. A sense of urgency looms as the Agents are expected to arrive at any moment.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and elite warrior of the resistance, known for her bravery and loyalty. She has a deep emotional connection with Neo.
characters.position: Crouching behind a conveyor belt, observing the entrance
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to engage in combat

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A former resistance member turned traitor, seeking power and a return to the Matrix. He is cunning and self-serving.
characters.position: Nearby, monitoring the factory's security system on a portable terminal
characters.states: Cautious and calculating, keeping an eye on Trinity

characters.name: Newly Developed Agent
characters.description: A sophisticated Agent with unprecedented adaptability and learning capabilities, serving the Matrix.
characters.position: Approaching the factory from the north entrance
characters.states: Cold and efficient, ready to eliminate threats

actions.action: Trinity signals Cypher with a hand gesture, instructing him to begin the hack.
actions.dialogue: “Now, Cypher. We don’t have much time.”

actions.action: Cypher taps on his terminal, initiating the security system override.
actions.dialogue: “You got it, Trinity. Just keep those things away from me.”

actions.action: The Agent detects the security breach and speeds up its approach, ready to attack.
actions.dialogue: “Intruders detected. Initiating elimination protocol.”

actions.action: Trinity dashes out from her cover, firing her gun at the Agent to distract it from Cypher’s position.
actions.dialogue: “Cypher, hurry! I can’t hold it off for long!”

scenes.plot: Trinity and Cypher, despite their differences, must work together to infiltrate the factory and retrieve the code to disable the new Agents, all while evading detection and elimination by the Agents themselves.

chunk.text:
[12]			Gee-zus. 
[13]			I just thought. . . you were a guy. 
[14]			Do you want to go sorewhere and 			talk? 
[15]			That was you on the board tonight. 			That was your note, wasn't it? 
[16]			Who wouldn't? 
[17]			What? Why? 
[18]			I don't understand --  
[19]			The Matrix. What is the Matrix? 
[20]			Wait. Who was it? Who was the 			man? 	She leans close, her lips alrost touching his ear as she 	whispers. 
[21] 	The sound is an ALARM CLOCK, slowly dragging Neo to 	consciousness. He strains to read the clock face: 
[22]			Shitshitshit. 
[23]			Yes, Mr. Rhineheart. Perfectly 			clear. 
[24] 	The entire floor looks like a human honeycomb, with a 	labyrinth of cubicles structured around a core of 	elevators. 	Neo slumps down into his chair. A TALL EMPLOYEE stands 	up in the adjacent cubicle, leaning over the partition. 
[25]			If I was late again, I'm going to 			be fired. 	He smirks. 
[26]			Yeah. That's me. 	Neo signs the electronic pad and the Fedex guy hands him 	the softpak. 
[27]			Hello? 
[28]			. . . no. 
[29]			Who's coming for me? 
[30]			Right now? 
[31]			Holy fuckin' shit! 
[32]			What the fuck do they want with 			me? ! 
[33]			How? ! 
[34]			But what if. . . ? 
[35]			How do you know all this? 	Morpheus laughs quietly. 
[36]			No! It's too far away. 
[37]			No way, no way, this is crazy. 
[38]			This is insane! Why is this 			happening to me? What did I do? 			I'm nobody. I didn't do anything. 			Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! 	He climbs up onto the window ledge. Hanging onto the 	frame, he steps onto the small ledge. 	The scaffold seems even farther away. 
[39]			I'm going to die. 	The WIND suddenly BLASTS up the face of the building, 	knocking Neo off balance. Recoiling, he clings harder to 	the frame, and the phone falls out of his hand. 	He watches as it is swallowed by the distance beneath him. 
[40]			This is insane. I can't do this! 			Forget it! 	He climbs back into the office just as a cop opens the 	door. 
[41]			I didn't do anything! 
[42]			Yeah. Wow. That sounds like a 			real good deal. But I think I 			have a better one. How about I 			give you the finger --  	He does. 
[43]			And you can cram that file up your 			Secret Service sphincter. 	Agent Smith puts his glasses back on. 
[44]			You ain't seen nothing yet. 
[45]			You can't scare me with this 			gestapo crap. I know my rights. 			I want my phone call. 	Agent Smith smiles. 
[46] 	Screaming, Neo bolts upright in bed. 	He realizes that he is home. Was it a dream? His mouth 	is normal. His stomach looks fine. He starts to take a 	deep, everything-is-okay breath, when --  	The PHONE RINGS. 	It almost stops his heart. It CONTINUES RINGING, 	building pressure in the room, forcing him up out of bed, 	sucking him in with an almost gravitational force. 	He answers it, saying nothing. 
[47]			The agents --  
[48]			. . . Yes. 
[49]			What are you doing? 
[50]			What are you doing? 
[51]			Jesus! God! 
[52]			Do what? 	The instant he hears the word, he knows. 
[53]			Oh, shit --  	The cry is frozen in his mouth as the paddles hit his 	chest. Gizmo wrestles with the bug. 
[54]			It's an honor. 
[55]			You could say that. 
[56]			You're Morpheus, you're a legend. 			Most hackers would die to meet 			you. 
[57]			No. 
[58]			Because I don't like the idea that 			I'm not in control of my life. 
[59]			What gift? 
[60]			It's not magic. 
[61]			Free from what? 
[62]			What truth? 
[63]			How? 
[64]			Apoc? You wrote the Four Horsemen 			Virus. 
[65]			A little. 
[66]			Essentially, it's a hardware 			system that uses an apparatus; 			headgear, gloves and whatever to 			make you feel that you are in a 			computer program. 
[67]			You might not, no. 
[68]			You did all this? 	She nods, placing a set of headphones over his ears. 	They are wired to an old hotel phone. 
[69]			Shit. . . 	Cypher works with Apoc checking reams of phosphorescent 	data. Trinity monitors Neo's electric vital signs. 	Neo reaches out to touch the mirror and his fingers 	disappear beneath the rippling surface. 	Quickly, he tries to pull his fingers out but the mirror 	stretches in long rubbery strands like mirrored-taffy 	stuck to his fingertips. 
[70]			What is this? Mescaline? 
[71]			Uh-oh. . . 
[72]			It's cold. 	The mirror creeps up his neck as Neo begins to panic, 	tipping his head as though he were sinking into the 	mirror, trying to keep his mouth up. 
[73]			It's all over me --  	Morpheus is right next to him, with the phone. 
[74] 	Neo's eyes flutter open. We see Trinity's face above us, 	angelic in the fluorescent glow of a light stick. 
[75] 
[76]			. . . am I dead? 
[77] 	He opens his eyes again, something tingling through him.

scenes.time: 10:00 PM, 2nd June, 2199
scenes.location: An abandoned sector outside Zion's underground base
scenes.description: A dimly lit, desolate area with废弃的建筑物 and 荒草丛生的地面. The air is filled with a faint digital static.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A key member of the resistance, skilled in martial arts and weaponry, with a deep affection for Neo.
characters.position: Crouching behind a half-broken wall, observing the entrance.
characters.states: Alert and curious, ready to spring into action.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A former resistance member turned traitor, adept at hacking and manipulating data streams.
characters.position: Standing near the entrance, typing on a portable terminal.
characters.states: Suspicious and calculating, his eyes reflect a hidden agenda.

actions.action: Trinity carefully scans the area with her gaze, her hand resting on her pistol.
actions.dialogue: “This place feels off. Like it's a part of the Matrix that's been forgotten.”

actions.action: Cypher taps his terminal and a hidden door slides open with a low hum.
actions.dialogue: “I've found a way in. It's a backdoor to the early Matrix. Power like this could change everything.”

actions.action: Trinity quickly checks her weapons and nods at Cypher, signaling to move in.
actions.dialogue: “Let's see what secrets this place holds. But stay sharp, Cypher. We're not alone here.”

scenes.plot: Trinity and Cypher, while on patrol, stumble upon a hidden program that could potentially threaten the stability of the Matrix. The scene sets the stage for a deeper exploration of their characters' motivations and the consequences of their actions.

He focuses and sees his body pierced with dozens of 	acupuncture-like needles wired to a strange device.

[79]			Why do my eyes hurt?

He pulls it out, 	staring at the grafted outlet. 	He feels his bald head. His fingers find and explore the 	large outlet in the base of his skull. [102]			Holy shit! 
[103]			Hell yes! 
[104]			This is incredible. I know Kung 			Fu. 	Morpheus sits in the drive chair next to hin. He nods to 	Tank. 
[105]			You -- You're too fast. 
[106]			I, uh. . . maybe. 
[107]			I feel better. 
[108]			Shit. 	Neo looks down at the street twenty floors below, then at 	Morpheus an impossible fifty feet away. 
[109]			Okie dokie. 	He takes a deep breath. 
[110]			Yeah. Free my mind. Right. No 			problem. 	He concentrates. Runs. 
[111]			I thought it wasn't real. 	Neo stares at the blood. 
[112]			If you are killed in the Matrix, 			you die here? 
[113] 	Trinity enters from the hall, carrying a try of food. 
[114]			Sorry. 
[115]			What are you doing? 
[116]			Is that. . . ? 
[117]			Jeez, I was wondering about that. 
[118]			Why I was bald here but not in the 			Matrix. 
[119]			Residual self image. 
[120]			Life systems monitor, glucose 			levels. 
[121]			Main power supply to the core. 	He follows Tank to the operator's station where he points 	to a red key-switch. 
[122]			Mainframe self-destruct. Uses all 			remaining power to generate an. . . 
[123]			What's he talking about? 
[124]			See who? 
[125]			Did you have to do this? 
[126]			What did she tell you? 
[127]			Any of them true? 	Trinity looks at him, then looks away. 
[128]			The agents. They're sentient 			programs. They can commandeer any 			software hardwired to the 			mainframe. 
[129]			The best hacking is always 			traceless. 	Cypher and Trinity move away from them, securing the 	perimeter. As Cypher passes a garbage can, he 	surreptitiously drops something inside. 	It is a cellular phone and we watch the blue display as 	the LINE CONNECTS. 	An early 1970s, black Lincoln Continental emerges from a 	corrugated roll-up garage. Morpheus and Neo get in. 
[130]			What -- what happened? 
[131]			There is no spoon. Right. 	He concentrates. The spoon begins to bend just as the 	Priestess touches his shoulder. 
[132]			Hello? 	A DISTANT FEMALE VOICE calls to him and he follows it up 	the stairs. At the top of the dais, he smells something 	cooking. 	Following the scent, he moves behind the pillars where he 	finds an open door. 
[133]			Hello? 
[134]			You're the Oracle? 
[135]			Yeah. 
[136]			What vase? 	He turns to look around and his elbow knocks a VASE from 	the table. It BREAKS against the linoleum floor. 
[137]			Shit, I'm sorry. 	She pulls out a tray of chocolate chip cookies and turns. 	She is an older woman, wearing big oven mitts, 	comfortable slacks and a print blouse. She looks like 	someone's grandma. 
[138]			How did you know. . . ? 	She sets the cookie tray on a wooden hot-pad. 
[139]			Who? 
[140]			I think so. 
[141]			I don't know. 	She gestures to a wooden plaque, the kind every grandma 	has, except that the words are in Latin. 
[142]			What's the good news? 
[143]			Is that it, then? 
[144]			You do? 
[145]			Whoa.

scenes.event: The Discovery of the Forgotten AI
scenes.location: An abandoned sector outside Zion's underground base
scenes.description: A dimly lit, desolate area with废弃的墙壁 and 腐蚀的管道, the air is filled with a faint electronic hum.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A calm and determined resistance fighter with a deep affection for Neo. Skilled in martial arts and weaponry with excellent tactical analysis abilities.
characters.position: Crouching near a rusted door, her gaze fixed on the mysterious entrance.
characters.states: Alert and curious, her body tense and ready for action.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A cunning and selfish former resistance member, now secretly collaborating with the Agents. Proficient in hacking and manipulating data streams within the Matrix.
characters.position: Standing back, his eyes darting between Trinity and the entrance, a calculating look on his face.
characters.states: Suspicious and eager, his hands rest near his weapons.

actions.action: Trinity carefully approaches the entrance, her hand reaching out to touch the flickering digital code.
actions.dialogue: “This is it. This could be the break we need. We have to tell Morpheus.”

actions.action: Cypher steps forward, a sly grin on his face, his hand moving to his pocket where he conceal a data transmitter.
actions.dialogue: “Tell Morpheus? Why share the glory? This could be our ticket out of here, Trinity. Think about it.”

actions.action: Trinity turns to Cypher, her eyes narrowing, her voice firm and determined.
actions.dialogue: “We fight for the Resistance, Cypher. Not for personal gain. You know the rules.”

scenes.plot: Trinity and Cypher's discovery of a forgotten AI program leads to a confrontation over whether to share the information with Morpheus or exploit it for personal gain, highlighting the difference in their loyalties and moral compass within the Matrix.
