scenes.time: Several hours after sunset, a few days after the rescue of Morpheus
scenes.location: An abandoned warehouse in an industrial district near Zion
scenes.description: The scene is set in a dimly lit, derelict warehouse. The atmosphere is tense as the characters discuss their next move. The sounds of distant machinery hum in the background.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A calm and determined savior of the Matrix, with the ability to manipulate reality within the simulation.
characters.position: Standing in the center of the room, gazing intently at a map of the Matrix on the wall.
characters.states: Serene and focused, ready to take on the incoming threat.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A brave and loyal hacker, deeply committed to Neo and the resistance.
characters.position: Leaning against a nearby console, arms crossed, observing the discussion.
characters.states: Alert and thoughtful, ready to contribute her insights.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A resilient and resourceful member of the resistance, skilled in operating machinery and weapons.
characters.position: Sitting at a computer terminal, surrounded by wires and equipment.
characters.states: Determined and busy, working on something crucial.

actions.action: Turns to Tank, his voice steady, 'Tank, what have you found out about the new threat?'
Looks up from his terminal, his expression serious, 'They're a specialized unit, trained specifically to hunt us down. But I've located a vulnerability in their system.'
Steps forward, her voice filled with resolve, 'We need to strike before they do. I can get us inside.'
Nods in agreement, then turns to the map, 'Let's plan this carefully. We only have one shot at this.'

scenes.plot: The scene focuses on the reunion of Neo, Trinity, and Tank, and their subsequent planning to counter the new threat. It showcases their teamwork and strategic thinking under pressure.

chunk.text:
Deja vu. 	Those words stop the others dead in their tracks. 
[146]			Nothing. Just had a little deja 			vu. 
[147]			A black cat went past us and then 			I saw another that looked just 			like it. 
[148]			It might have been. I'm not sure. 	Trinity looks at Morpheus, who listens quietly to the 	rasping breath of the old building. 
[149]			What is it? 
[150]			I don't know. It just went dead. 	Trinity listens to the dead line and takes out the 	cellular. 
[151]			It's Tank! He's alive. 	Cypher lunges for Neo's plug just as Tank BLOWS his head 	off. 
[152]			Yeah. Right. 
[153]			What are they doing to him? 
[154]			How? 
[155]			How much time? 
[156]			The access codes to Zion. 
[157]			You need help. I'm coming with 			you. 
[158]			Morpheus did what he did because 			he believed that I'm something 			that I'm not. 
[159]			I'm not the One, Trinity. The 			Oracle told me. 	Trinity is stunned. 
[160]			She said I had a gift but I still 			had a lot to learn. She told me 			maybe next life. 
[161]			Why? It wouldn't mean anything. 			He'd still believe what he wanted 			to believe. But Morpheus is the 			one that matters. He's more 			important than me and we both know 			it. 	He straps in. 
[162]			I may not be what Morpheus thinks 			I am, but if I don't try to help 			him, then I'm not even what I 			think I am. 
[163]			His friend. 
[164]			Yeah? 	He snap cocks an Uzi. 
[165]			That's why it's going to work. 
[166]			There is no spoon. 	Neo whips out his gun and presses it to the cable, lower 	than where they attached themselves. 	BOOM! The CABLE SNAPS. 	The counter-weights plummet, yanking Trinity and Neo up 	through the shaft as --  	The elevator falls away beneath them, distending space, 	filling it with the sound of WHISTLING METAL as they soar 	to the top. 
[167]			Trinity! 	Agent Jones charges. 
[168]			. . . help. 	His GUN BOOMS as we enter the liquid space of --  	Bullet-time. 	The AIR SIZZLES with wads of lead-like angry flies as Neo 	twists, bends, ducks just between them. 	Agent Jones still running, narrows the gap, the BULLETS 	coming faster until --  	Neo bent impossibly back, one hand on the ground as a 	spiraling gray ball shears open his shoulder. 	He starts to scream as another digs a red groove across 	his thigh. 	He has only time to look up, to see the barrel when Agent 	Jones, standing over him, pulls the TRIGGER the final 	time. 	CLICK. Empty. 	Neo rolls, reaching for another gun when around-house 	kick snaps his jaw. Agent Jones grabs the gun and levels 	it at Neo. 
[169]			Thanks. 
[170]			I'm fine. 	Neo is already looking at the helicopter. 
[171]			Can you fly that thing? 
[172]			Get up, Morpheus! Get up! 	Morpheus sits unmoving, his head still down. 	Neo grabs the climbing rope just as marines burst into 	the adjoining room. 	He attaches only one end to his harness when they OPEN 
[173]			He won't make it. 	Morpheus lunges, out of control --  	As Neo spins, every move a whip crack --  	Snapping the other rope-end onto a bolted bar. 	Morpheus begins to fall when Neo hurls himself into the 	wide blue empty space --  	Flying for a moment. 	The rope snaking out behind him; an umbilical cord 	attached to a machine. 	As their two bodies, set in motion, rushing at each other 	on a seemingly magnetic course until --  	They collide. 	Almost bouncing free of each other, arms, legs, 	scrambling, hands searching in furious desperation, 	finding hold and clinging. 	Until the line ends, snapping taut, cracking their 	fragile embrace. Morpheus tumbles, legs flipping over, 	falling down --  	The ground deliriously distant --  	As Neo snatches hold of his mentor's still handcuffed 	wrist. 
[174]			Gotcha! 	Trinity is already pulling the copter up and away. 	As Agent Smith grabs the M-16 from the nearest marine. 	He'll bring them all down. Targeting the helicopter, he 	aims at something only he can see: the oil line. 	PONK. PONK. PONK. The rear HULL is PUNCHED full of 	holes and smoke and oil pours out like black blood. 
[175]			Oh fuck. 	Trinity throws the helicopter towards the roof of the 	nearest building. 	Morpheus and Neo cling to one another as they and the 	machine above them begin to fall. 	The ENGINE GRINDS, the CHOPPING BLADES start to slow 	while --  	The Agents stand in the open shattered window, watching 	the helicopter disappear behind taller buildings. 	Carried by its nomentum, Trinity guides the parabolic 	fall over the nearest roof where --  	Neo and Morpheus drop safely, rolling free as the rope 	goes slack. Neo gets to his feet, trying to detach 	himself but --  	The helicopter is falling too fast, arcing over the roof 	like a setting sun --  	The coils of slack snap taught --  	Yanking Neo off his feet, dragging him with ferocious 	speed towards the edge even as --  	Trinity lunges for the back door, her gun in one hand, 	grabbing for the rope with the other --  	Neo flies like a skipping stone, hurtling straight AT us, 	when his feet hit the rain gutter --  	A fulcrum that levers him up just as --  	Trinity FIRES, severing the cord from the HELICOPTER, 	falling free of it as it SMASHES, blades first into a 	glass skyscraper. 	Holding onto the rope she swings, connected to Neo, who 	stands on the building's edge watching her arc beneath 	him as the HELICOPTER EXPLODES --  	She bounces against a shatterproof window that spider- 	cracks out while FLAMES ERUPT behind her. 
[176]			Morpheus, I know you won't believe 			me but the Oracle told ne I'm not 			the One. 
[177]			Don't! 	The Old Man stops, Neo rushes at hin, gliding smoothly 	over the turnstiles. 
[178]			Get outta here. Okay? Run! Go!

scenes.location: A secret data repository deep within the Matrix
scenes.description: A dimly lit, cavernous room filled with towering servers and a network of cables. The air is cool and stale, and the hum of the machinery is deafening. Neo and Trinity are dressed in black, moving stealthily through the room, while Cypher lurks in the shadows, observing their every move.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A computer programmer turned savior, with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. He is determined and possesses exceptional combat skills.
characters.position: Standing at the mainframe, his gaze is fixed on the digital code flowing down the screens.
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to react to any threats.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A fierce resistance fighter and a skilled pilot, deeply committed to Neo. She is agile and has a keen sense of awareness.
characters.position: Crouching near the entrance, keeping a lookout for any signs of trouble.
characters.states: Wary and prepared, her hand resting on her weapon.

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A traitor within Morpheus's crew, skilled in hacking and manipulation. He is cunning and has set a trap for Neo and Trinity.
characters.position: Hidden behind a column, his eyes glinting with mischief.
characters.states: Sneaky and watchful, his fingers tapping on a hidden console.

actions.action: Neo's fingers dance across the keyboard as he attempts to decrypt the data packet that will disable Agent Smith.
actions.dialogue: “This is it, Trinity. I'm close to shutting Smith down for good.”

actions.action: Trinity glances over her shoulder, whispering a warning to Neo.
actions.dialogue: “Neo, we're not alone. I can feel it. Cypher is here somewhere.”

actions.action: Cypher smirks as he activates a virus that will erase the data they seek, then whispers into his communicator.
actions.dialogue: “Enjoy your little mission, kids. It's about to get a whole lot harder.”

scenes.plot: As Neo and Trinity race against time to secure the vital data, they are unaware that Cypher has laid a trap for them. The scene builds tension as it sets up the conflict between the protagonists and the cunning traitor, with the future of the resistance hanging in the balance.

chunk.text:
The Old Man nods, turns and hurries deeper into the urban 	cave, disappearing into the shadows as Trinity and 	Morpheus arrive. 
[179]			It was nobody. 	Neo turns to the RINGING BOOTH. 
[180]			Let's go! You first, Morpheus. 	Morpheus gets in and answers the phone. 	Lost in the shadow, the Old Man turns back and watches as 	Morpheus disappears, the phone dropping, dangling by its 	cord. 	His eyes grow wide, glowing white in the dark. 
[181]			I believe. . . 	He stares at the fullness of her lips. 
[182]			I want to kiss you. 	She smiles. 
[183]			So are you. 	The smile falls. Agent Smith yanks his TRIGGER. 
[184]			I already have. 	He attacks with a vicious series of blows but the Agent 	seems to absorb them, waiting for his opening. 	And this time Agent Smith's attack is too much, an 	unrelenting fury, fists pounding like jackhammers. 
[185]			My name is Neo. 	Impossibly, he hurls himself straight up, smashing Smith 	against the concrete ceiling of the tunnel. 	They fall as the sound and fury of the TRAIN EXPLODES 	INTO the station. 	Neo back-flips up off the tracks just as --  	The train barrels over Agent Smith. 	Neo stands, knees shaking, when the train slams on its 	emergency brake. With an ear-splitting SHRIEK of 	TORTURED RAILS, the train slows, part of it still in the 	station. 	Neo turns, limping, starting to run, racing for the 	escalator --  	As the train comes to a stop and the doors of the last 	car open; Agent Smith bursts out in furious pursuit, his 	glasses again intact. 
[186]			Mr. Wizard, Get me the fuck out 			of here! 
[187]			Hurry, Tank! I got some serious 			pursuit! 
[188]			I'm trying, Trinity. I'm trying. 
[189]			Hi. It's me. I know you're out 			there. I know you're working as 			fast as you can to catch me. 	We CLOSE IN ON the racing columns of numbers shimmering 	across the screen. 
[190]			I thought I should call and let 			you know how things stand. 	We DIVE THROUGH the numbers, surging UP THROUGH the 	darkness, sucked TOWARDS a tight constellation of stars. 
[191]			I know you're real proud of this 			world you've built, the way it 			works, all the nice little rules 			and such, but I've got some bad 			news. 	We realize that the constellation is actually the holes 	in the mouthpiece of a phone. Seen from inside. 
[192]			I've decided to make a few 			changes. 	We SHOOT THROUGH the holes as Neo hangs up the phone. 	He steps out of the phone booth and starts walking, 	wearing a long black coat and dark glasses. He passes a 	mother dragging her little BOY, who cranes his neck as --  	Neo takes off, flying up into the air. ",
        "Cypher": "
[1]			Let's see. Target left work at 
[2]			He caught the northbound Howard 			line. Got off at Sheridan. 			Stopped at 7-11. Purchased six- 			pack of beer and a box of Captain 			Crunch. Returned home. 	The area code is identified. The first three numbers 	suddenly fixed, leaving only seven flowing columns. 	We begin MOVING TOWARD the screen, CLOSING IN as each 	digit is matched, one by one, snapping into place like 	the wheels of a slot machine. 
[3]			Do you know when we're going to 			make contact? 
[4]			Just between you and me, you don't 			believe it, do you? You don't 			believe this guy is the one? 
[5]			I know. But what about you? 
[6]			Yeah, but if he's wrong --  	The final number pops into place --  
[7]			Hear what? 
[8]			Yeah, course I'm sure. 	We MOVE STILL CLOSER, the ELECTRIC HUM of the green 	numbers GROWING INTO an OMINOUS ROAR. 
[9]			Yeah. Right. See you on the other side. 	She hangs up as we PASS THROUGH the numbers, entering the 	netherworld of the computer screen. 	Where gradually the sound of a police radio grows around 	us. 
[10]			Shit. 
[11]			Morpheus, I know what you believe 			but I think this is a mistake. 			We're rushing him. He's old. I'm 			afraid he might pop. 
[12]			I knew it, I knew it. . . 
[13]			He's gonna pop! 
[14]			He's going to pop! 	Vomiting violently, Neo pitches forward and blacks out. 
[15]			Everyone falls, right, Trinity? 	But Trinity has left. 	Neo's eyes open as Tank eases the plug out. He tries to 	move and groans, cradling his ribs. 	While Tank helps Morpheus, Neo spits blood into his hand. 
[16]			Whoa! Shit, Neo, you scared the 			bejeezus out of ne. 
[17]			No, it's all right. 
[18]			Midnight watch. 	Neo's eyes light up as he steps closer to the screens 	that seem alive with a constant flow of data. 
[19]			The Matrix? Yeah. 	The monitors are packed with bizarre codes and equations. 
[20]			You want a drink? 	He pours Neo a drink from a large plastic jug. 
[21]			I'll tell you, I feel for you, 			man. I really do. Most of us 			were still young, just punks, when 			Morpheus jacked us. But you, you 			had a real life. 	Neo takes a sip and it almost kills him. Cypher pounds 	on his back. 
[22]			Good shit, huh? Dozer makes it. 			It's good for two things: 			degreasing engines and killing 			brain cells. 	Red-faced, Neo finally stops coughing. 
[23]			Did he tell you why he did it? 	Neo nods. 
[24]			I'll be the didn't tell you that 			this wasn't the first time he 			thought he found the One. 	Neo shakes his head as Cypher fills his cup and laughs. 
[25]			Let me give you a piece of advice.

scenes.time: Early morning, several months after Neo's revelation as The One
scenes.location: A dimly lit back alley in the heart of the Matrix
scenes.description: The alley is shrouded in a thick digital mist, the virus' presence is felt in the distorted visuals and slowed time dilation. The atmosphere is tense and eerie.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and a key member of the resistance, known for her combat abilities and loyalty to Neo.
characters.position: Crouched on a rooftop, observing the alley below
characters.states: Alert and ready for action, her expression is one of determination

characters.name: Cypher
characters.description: A former resistance member turned traitor, seeking personal gain and a deal with the Agents.
characters.position: Standing at the entrance of the alley, his figure partially hidden in the shadows
characters.states: Calm and calculating, with a hint of anticipation

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A powerful Agent of the Matrix, relentless in pursuit of the resistance and the preservation of the system.
characters.position: Materializing from the digital mist, in the center of the alley
characters.states: Menacing and in control, displaying no emotion

actions.action: Trinity quickly calculates the best route to avoid the virus while staying undetected by Agent Smith.
actions.dialogue: “This virus is a wildcard. We need to be cautious.”

actions.action: Cypher cautiously approaches the alley, his eyes scanning for any sign of the virus or Agents.
actions.dialogue: “The virus could be my ticket out of this mess. I just need to stay ahead of the game.”

actions.action: Agent Smith suddenly spots Cypher and begins to advance towards him, his voice echoing through the alley.
actions.dialogue: “Cypher, you can't hide from the system. Your betrayal is destined to fail.”

actions.action: Trinity leaps from the rooftop, performing a graceful dive to intervene between Cypher and Agent Smith, her movements precise and swift.
actions.dialogue: “Not if we have anything to say about it. Cypher, we need to work together. Now!”

scenes.plot: The scene sets the stage for a conflict between the resistance members and the Agents, with the added threat of the mysterious virus. It explores themes of trust, betrayal, and the fight against an overwhelming system.

chunk.text:
Between you and me, if Morpheus 			says you can fly, I wouldn't go 			jumping out any windows to find 			out if he's right. Understand? 	Cypher raises his drink. Neo swallows another throat- 	scorching mouthful. 
[26]			Welcome to the real world! 
[27]			That's what he said to me nine 			years ago. 	The meat is so perfect, charred on the outside, oozing 	red juice from the inside, that it could be a dream. 
[28]			The real world. Ha, what a joke. 	We recognize the grating voice, the insidious laugh. 
[29]			You know what real is? I'll tell 			you what real is. 	A fork stabs the cube of meat and we FOLLOW it UP TO the 	face of Cypher. 
[30]			Real is just another four-letter 			word. 	He laughs, shoving the steak into his mouth. 	The restaurant is located on the top floor of a Chicago 	skyscraper where the view is breathtaking and the menu 	has no prices. 	Sitting across from Cypher is Agent Smith. 
[31]			Mmm, so, so fucking good. 	Smith watches him shovel another hunk of meat into his 	mouth. 
[32]			You know, I know that this steak 			doesn't exist. I know when I put 			it in my mouth, the Matrix is 			telling my brain that it is juicy 			and delicious. After nine years, 			do you know what I've realized? 	Pausing, he examines the meat skewered on his fork. He 	pops it in, eyes rolling up, savoring the tender beef 	melting in his mouth. 
[33]			Ignorance is bliss. 
[34]			I don't want to remember nothing. 			Nothing! You understand? And I 			want to be rich. Someone 			important. Like an actor. You 			can do that, right? 
[35]			All right. You get my body back 			in a power plant, reinsert me into 			the Matrix and I'll get you what 			you want. 
[36]			I told you, I don't know them. 			But I can give you the man who 			does. 
[37]			That's what they changed. We're 			trapped. There's no way out. 	The sound of heavy BOOT-STEPS close around them with the 	mechanical sureness of a vice. 
[38]			I need an exit! Fast! 
[39]			There was an accident. A fucking 			car accident. All of a sudden. 			Boom. They're all dead. I still 			got the shakes but, Jesus, 			someone's going to make a believer 			out of me. 
[40]			Just get me outta here. 
[41]			An actor. Definitely. 
[42]			Goddamn gas. My lungs are killing 			me. 	He crosses to an overhead bin. 
[43]			We got any pain killers? 
[44]			Hello, Trinity. 
[45]			He had an accident. 
[46]			You know, for a long time, I 			thought I was in love with you, 			Trinity. I used to dream about 			you. . . 	He nuzzles his face against hers, feeling the softness of 	it. 
[47]			You are a beautiful woman. Too 			bad things had to work out like 			this. 	We INTERCUT BETWEEN the appliance store and the main 	deck. 
[48]			In a way you're very lucky. Most 			people never know why they die. 			One minute they're alive, the next 			they're dead. No warning. 			Nothing. That's why I thought 			maybe I should tell you. It 			seemed the least I could do. 	He stands over the body of Morpheus, as his anger boils 	up out of him. 
[49]			You see, the truth, the real,truth 			is that the war is over. It's 			been over for a long time. And 			guess what? We lost! Did you 			hear that? We lost the war! 
[50]			Zion? Zion is a part of this 			delusion. More of this madness. 			That's why this has to be done. 			It has to end. Now and forever. 	She suddenly sees the entire dark plan. 
[51]			You see, Trinity, we humans have a 			place in the future. But it's not 			here. It's in the Matrix. 
[52]			Oh, I disagree, Trinity. I 			disagree. I think the Matrix is 			more real than this world. I 			mean, all I do is pull a plug 			here. But there, you watch a man 			die. 	He grabs hold of the cable in Apoc's neck, twists it and 	yanks it out. 
[53]			You tell me which is more real. 	Apoc seems to go blind for an instant, a scream caught in 	his throat, his hands reaching for nothing, and then 	falls dead. Switch screams. 
[54]			Welcome to the real world, right? 	He laughs. 
[55]			Pay for it? I'm not even going to 			remember it. It'll be like it 			never happened. The tree falling 			in the forest. It doesn't make a 			sound. 	His hand slides around the neck of Switch as he takes 	hold of her plug. 	She suddenly feels her body severed from her mind as she 	is murdered. 
[56]			Don't hate me, Trinity. I'm just 			the messenger. And right now I'm 			going to prove that the message is 			true. 	He stands over Neo. 
[57]			If Morpheus was right, then 			there's no way I can pull this 			plug, is there? 	She turns to Neo, eyes wide with fear, and he knows he is 	next. 
[58]			If he is the One, then in the next 			few seconds there has to be some 			kind of miracle to stop me. 			Because if he dies like the others 			that means Morpheus was wrong. 			How can he be the One if he's 			dead? 	He takes hold of the cord when --  	She hears an EXPLOSION and a scream. 	Cypher is on the ground, his left leg blown off at the 	knee.

scenes.time: 10:00 PM, 2nd May, Year 2199
scenes.location: Zion's Secret Research Facility, Central Control Room
scenes.description: The control room is bathed in the glow of a thousand monitors, the air is tense with the hum of machinery. A red alert is flashing, indicating the activation of a secret defense system.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and warrior, known for her bravery and loyalty to Neo. Proficient in martial arts and firearms, with sharp insight and quick reflexes.
characters.position: Standing at the main console, her fingers dancing across the keyboard.
characters.states: Anxious, focused, and determined to find a solution.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A tech expert of the resistance, who maintains and operates the systems aboard the Nebuchadnezzar. Calm and intelligent, with a passion for technology.
characters.position: Next to Trinity, his eyes scanning the diagnostic readings.
characters.states: Calm under pressure, his mind racing to find a way to override the defense system.

characters.name: Cypher's Digital Consciousness
characters.description: Once a member of the resistance, now a digital consciousness after his betrayal and death. Cunning and self-serving, with a unique perspective on reality and the Matrix.
characters.position: Projected as a hologram in the center of the room, his form flickering slightly.
characters.states: Sarcastic and somewhat amused by the situation, yet willing to help for his own reasons.

actions.action: Trinity rapidly taps on the console, her eyes locked on the screen, trying to decipher the defense system's code.
actions.dialogue: “We need to shut this down, now! It's locking us out of every system!”

actions.action: Tank reaches for a portable terminal, his fingers moving with precision as he attempts to bypass the security protocols.
actions.dialogue: “I'm working on it! The system's got multiple layers of encryption. It's going to take time!”

actions.action: Cypher's hologram waves a hand dismissively, his voice echoing through the room.
actions.dialogue: “Time is something you don't have. Let me help. I've got a backdoor into their mainframe.”

scenes.plot: The scene unfolds as Trinity and Tank race against time to deactivate the defense system that threatens the facility. The unexpected ally, Cypher's digital consciousness, adds a layer of intrigue and urgency to their mission.

That's why I thought 			maybe I should tell you. It 			seemed the least I could do. 	He stands over the body of Morpheus, as his anger boils 	up out of him. 
[49]			You see, the truth, the real,truth 			is that the war is over. It's 			been over for a long time. And 			guess what? We lost! Did you 			hear that? We lost the war! 
[50]			Zion? Zion is a part of this 			delusion. More of this madness. 			That's why this has to be done. 			It has to end. Now and forever. 	She suddenly sees the entire dark plan. 
[51]			You see, Trinity, we humans have a 			place in the future. But it's not 			here. It's in the Matrix. 
[52]			Oh, I disagree, Trinity. I 			disagree. I think the Matrix is 			more real than this world. I 			mean, all I do is pull a plug 			here. But there, you watch a man 			die. 	He grabs hold of the cable in Apoc's neck, twists it and 	yanks it out. 
[53]			You tell me which is more real. 	Apoc seems to go blind for an instant, a scream caught in 	his throat, his hands reaching for nothing, and then 	falls dead. Switch screams. 
[54]			Welcome to the real world, right? 	He laughs. 
[55]			Pay for it? I'm not even going to 			remember it. It'll be like it 			never happened. The tree falling 			in the forest. It doesn't make a 			sound. 	His hand slides around the neck of Switch as he takes 	hold of her plug. 	She suddenly feels her body severed from her mind as she 	is murdered. 
[56]			Don't hate me, Trinity. I'm just 			the messenger. And right now I'm 			going to prove that the message is 			true. 	He stands over Neo. 
[57]			If Morpheus was right, then 			there's no way I can pull this 			plug, is there? 	She turns to Neo, eyes wide with fear, and he knows he is 	next. 
[58]			If he is the One, then in the next 			few seconds there has to be some 			kind of miracle to stop me. 			Because if he dies like the others 			that means Morpheus was wrong. 			How can he be the One if he's 			dead? 	He takes hold of the cord when --  	She hears an EXPLOSION and a scream. 	Cypher is on the ground, his left leg blown off at the 	knee.

scenes.time: Several hours before the scheduled encounter between Neo and Morpheus
scenes.location: A desolate data relay station on the outskirts of Zion
scenes.description: The atmosphere is thick with tension and poorly illuminated. The persistent hum of electronic equipment forms a backdrop to the scene. Trinity and Tank are immersed in a labyrinth of wires and computer parts, their race against time to restore the relay station's functionality while evading the relentless Agent Smith.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: Adept at hacking and combat, Trinity is renowned for her courage and tenacity. She possesses a sharp mind and quick reflexes.
characters.position: Hunched over a console, her fingers dancing across the keyboard.
characters.states: Urgent, focused, and determined to succeed.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A technical expert from Zion, responsible for the maintenance and enhancement of the resistance's hardware and software.
characters.position: Seated at a workbench, surrounded by an array of tools and circuitry.
characters.states: Nervous, meticulous, and deeply engrossed in his task.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A potent computer program that hunts the resistance. He is relentless and cunning.
characters.position: Lurking outside the relay station, employing his abilities to search for signs of Trinity and Tank.
characters.states: Calm, calculating, and poised to strike.

actions.action: Trinity's fingers move rapidly over the keyboard, her gaze flitting between multiple screens as she battles to override the virus's control of the system.
actions.dialogue: "We're running out of time. I need that firewall down, now!"

actions.action: Tank's hands remain steady as he solders a connection under pressure. He glances at Trinity with a mix of concern and concentration.
actions.dialogue: "Almost there. Just need to realign these power nodes."

actions.action: Agent Smith moves with inhuman speed, closing in on the relay station. His eyes glow with a sinister light.
actions.dialogue: "You can't hide forever, Trinity. Tank. Your time is up."

scenes.plot: In a desperate bid to ensure Neo's crucial meeting with Morpheus, Trinity and Tank collaborate to repair the vital relay station. However, they are being tracked by the tenacious Agent Smith, who is drawing near their location. The scene escalates in tension as the characters race against time to complete their mission and avoid capture.

He rolls over and finds Tank on the ground, and 	the sights of the plasma rifle. ",
        "Brown": "
[1]			Where are they? 
[2]			Perhaps we are asking the wrong 			questions. 
[3]			How? 
[4]			What were you doing? 	Agent Smith recovers, replacing his ear piece. 
[5]			They are actually attacking. 
[6]			The trace was completed. 
[7]			The extermination unit is in 			place. 
[8]			He's gone. 	Agent Smith smiles, standing over him. ",
        "Trinity": "
[1] 
[2]			All right, you're relieved. Use 			the usual exit. 
[3]			Soon. 	Only two thin digits left. 
[4]			I think Morpheus believes he is. 
[5]			I think Morpheus knows things that 			I don't. 
[6]			Did you hear that? 
[7]			Are you sure this line is clean? 
[8]			I better go. 
[9]			Shit. 
[10]			Morpheus! The link was traced! I 			don't know how. 
[11]			Are there any agents? 
[12]			Goddamnit! 
[13]			All right --  
[14]			Get up, Trinity. You're fine. 			Get up -- just get up! 	She stands and limps down the rest of the stairs. 
[15]			Hello, Neo. 
[16]			I know a lot about you. I've been 			wanting to meet you for some time. 
[17]			My name is Trinity. 
[18]			That was a long time ago. 
[19]			What? 
[20]			Most guys do. 	Neo is a little embarrassed. 
[21]			No. It's safe here and I don't 			have much time. 	The MUSIC is so loud they must stand very close, talking 	directly into each other's ear. 
[22]			I had to gamble that you would see 			and they wouldn't. 
[23]			I can't explain everything to you. 			I'm sure that it's all going to 			seem very strange, but I brought 			you here to warn you, Neo. You 			are in a lot of danger. 
[24]			They're watching you. Something 			happened and they found out about 			you. Normally, if our target is 			exposed we let it go. But this 			time, we can't do that. 
[25]			You came here because you wanted 			to know the answer to a hacker's 			question. 
[26]			Twelve years ago I met a man, a 			great man, who said that no one 			could be told the answer to that 			question. That they had to see 			it, to believe it. 	Her body is against his; her lips very close to his ear. 
[27]			He told me that no one should look 			for the answer unless they have to 			because once you see it, 			everything changes. Your life and 			the world you live in will never 			be the same. It's as if you wake 			up one morning and the sky is 			falling. 	There is a hypnotic quality to her voice and Neo feels 	the words like a drug, seeping into him. 
[28]			The truth is out there, Neo. It's 			looking for you and it will find 			you, if you want it to. 	She takes hold of him with her eyes. 
[29]			That's all I can tell you right 			now. Good-bye, Neo. And good 			luck. 
[30]			You know who. 	She turns and he watches her melt into the shifting wall 	of bodies. 	A SOUND RISES steadily, growing out of the music, 	pressing in on Neo until it is all he can hear as we --  
[31]			Shit. 
[32]			We got him. Call the chop-shop. 	She hangs up. 
[33]			Listen to me, Neo. You have to, 			trust us. 	She tears off a long strip of black duct-tape and reaches 	for his face. 
[34]			This has to be done for your 			protection and ours. 	She seals his eyes shut with the tape. 
[35]			You can't understand right now, 			but if you're not one of us, 			you're one of them. 
[36]			Hello, Gizmo. 	Neo hears the voices around him. 
[37]			Yeah. 
[38]			Are you going to help us or aren't 			you? 
[39]			We think you're bugged. We can't 			take you to Morpheus until you're 			clean. 
[40]			What's happening? 
[41]			Do something! 
[42]			Are you crazy? That will kill 			him. 	We watch Neo, who can't see what they are talking about. 
[43]			Clear. 
[44]			Neo, are you okay? 	He nods. 
[45]			It's over. We got it. 	Hanging from the claw pick is the inanimate metal wire- 	tap. 
[46]			Thanks for your help, Gizmo. 
[47]			Gizmo, you don't have the hardware 			to handle this software. 	He howls with adolescent laughter as the van pulls away. 	Trinity turns to Neo. 
[48]			Let's go. He's waiting. 
[49]			This is it. 	Neo can hear his own heart pounding. 
[50]			Let me give one piece of advice. 			Be honest. He knows more than you 			can possibly imagine. 
[51]			I knew he would. 	Cypher saddles up to Morpheus, talking in a hushed tone 	away from, Neo. 
[52]			It's going into replication. 
[53]			I got a fibrillation! 
[54]			He's going into arrest! 
[55]			Far from it.

scenes.time: Shortly before Neo's arrival at Zion
scenes.location: A hidden communication outpost near Zion
scenes.description: The outpost is dimly lit, with various computer screens flickering. The air is tense with the urgency of the task at hand. The sounds of distant gunfire can be heard, reminding the characters of the constant threat.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A seasoned resistance fighter with excellent hacking skills and a calm demeanor. She has complex feelings towards Neo and is both怀疑 and hopeful.
characters.position: Standing at the main console, her fingers flying over the keyboard.
characters.states: Anxious, focused, and determined.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A tech expert of Zion, Tank is introverted and meticulous. He has an immense courage and wisdom during critical moments.
characters.position: Bent over a wiring panel, tools in hand.
characters.states: Concentrated, with a hint of worry.

actions.action: Trinity rapidly taps on the keyboard, her eyes scanning the code on the screen, searching for any sign of Agent Smith's intrusion.
actions.dialogue: “We don’t have much time. If Smith has compromised the system, we need to find out how and stop him before Neo gets here.”

actions.action: Tank carefully reconnects a severed cable, his hands steady despite the pressure. He glances at Trinity with a look that suggests an idea.
actions.dialogue: “What if we route the signal through a different frequency? It might bypass his surveillance.”

actions.action: Trinity nods in agreement and starts to modify the frequency settings. Her face brightens as the console begins to show positive results.
actions.dialogue: “That’s it! We’re back online. Now, let’s make sure Neo gets this message.”

scenes.plot: In a race against time, Trinity and Tank work together to repair the communication device, ensuring Neo's safe arrival at Zion while evading Agent Smith's watchful eye.

scenes.event: The Discovery of the Forgotten Technology
scenes.time: Early morning, a few days after the escape from the Matrix
scenes.location: An abandoned maintenance bay, deep within the Zion underground base
scenes.description: The bay is dimly lit, filled with old, dust-covered machinery. The air is stale, but there's a sense of urgency as Trinity and Tank search for the lost technology that could save Zion.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and fighter, Trinity is determined and intelligent, loyal to the cause of the resistance.
characters.position: Standing next to a large, inactive console, her eyes scanning the room for any sign of the technology.
characters.states: Alert and focused, her expression is one of determination.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: A tech expert of Zion, Tank is reserved and calm, passionate about technology.
characters.position: Crouching over a series of intricate wiring, his hands moving deftly as he tries to decipher the ancient system.
characters.states: Engrossed in his work, his brow is furrowed in concentration.

actions.action: Trinity carefully examines the walls, looking for any hidden compartments or panels that might house the technology.
actions.dialogue: “This place is a labyrinth. We need to find it soon, or it could be too late for Zion.”

actions.action: Tank taps into the console with a few wires, trying to bring the ancient system online.
actions.dialogue: “Almost there... this should reactivate the power to the mainframe.”

actions.action: Trinity spots a loose panel and pries it open, revealing a hidden compartment with the ancient technology.
actions.dialogue: “Got it! This looks like the relay we need to boost our defenses.”

actions.action: Tank joins Trinity and together they work on integrating the ancient technology with Zion's existing systems.
actions.dialogue: “We have to be cautious. If we do this right, we might just give the Sentinels a run for their money.”

scenes.plot: In this scene, the urgency of the situation is palpable as Trinity and Tank race against time to find and activate the forgotten technology that could turn the tide in Zion's favor. The scene highlights their teamwork and the importance of their individual skills in the face of a common threat.

scenes.event: The Discovery of the Lost Program
scenes.time: Early evening, several months after Neo's revelation as 'The One'
scenes.location: An abandoned factory within the Matrix
scenes.description: A dimly lit, rusted factory filled with the hum of machinery. The air is thick with dust and the scent of ozone. Neo and Trinity stand before a flickering computer terminal, their figures casting long shadows on the walls.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A confident and skilled hacker, now realizing his full potential as 'The One'.
characters.position: Standing in front of the computer terminal, hands moving deftly over the keyboard.
characters.states: Focused and determined, with a hint of excitement in his eyes.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A highly trained and resourceful resistance fighter, deeply committed to Neo and the cause.
characters.position: To Neo's side, gun in hand, scanning the surroundings for any sign of trouble.
characters.states: Alert and ready, her expression one of fierce protectiveness.

actions.action: With a series of swift keystrokes, Neo taps into the terminal, his eyes locked on the screen as code streams by.
actions.dialogue: “This is it, Trinity. A backdoor into the mainframe. We can use this to shift the balance of power.”

actions.action: Glancing over her shoulder, she speaks in a low voice, her gaze never leaving the entrance of the factory.
actions.dialogue: “We need to move fast. They’ll be onto us soon. Can you download it before they trace us?”

actions.action: Neo nods, his fingers dancing across the keyboard with increasing speed as the download progress bar fills.
actions.dialogue: “Almost there... just a few more seconds.”

scenes.plot: In this scene, Neo and Trinity inadvertently stumble upon a hidden program that could change the course of the war between humans and machines. The tension is high as they race against time to secure the program before the agents can track them down.

scenes.time: 10:00 PM, 2nd June, Year 2199
scenes.location: A high-security data repository within the Matrix
scenes.description: A dimly lit, sleek room with rows of servers and multiple security terminals. The atmosphere is tense with the silent hum of the servers and the team's focused breathing.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: The One, with the ability to perceive and manipulate the Matrix. Calm and decisive with a strong belief in freedom and truth.
characters.position: Standing at the entrance, ready to provide cover
characters.states: Alert and focused, ready to use his abilities if needed

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled fighter and tactical analyst, deeply committed to Neo and the cause of the resistance.
characters.position: Near the main terminal, prepared to assist Mouse
characters.states: Concentrated and ready, keeping an eye on the surroundings

characters.name: Mouse
characters.description: A technical genius, adept at navigating complex systems and creating virtual identities.
characters.position: In front of the main terminal, working on the data extraction
characters.states: Nervous but confident, fingers moving swiftly over the keyboard

actions.action: Scans the area with a heightened sense of awareness, ready to react to any threats.
actions.dialogue: “Stay sharp, we're not alone in here.”

actions.action: Watches the door, providing cover for Mouse while keeping an ear on the mission's progress.
actions.dialogue: “Almost there, Mouse. Just a little longer.”

actions.action: Types furiously on the terminal, bypassing security protocols and initiating the data download.
actions.dialogue: “Got it! Downloading now... this is the real deal, guys!”

scenes.plot: The scene sets the stage for the team's tense mission to extract critical data from a secure Matrix location. It highlights the distinct roles and abilities of each character and their collective effort to achieve the objective.

scenes.time: Midnight, several hours into the virus attack
scenes.location: Communication center, Zion base
scenes.description: The atmosphere is tense as the Zion communication system is under attack. The room is dimly lit, with multiple screens displaying lines of code and warning messages. The air is filled with the sound of keyboards and the low hum of servers.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A young computer programmer turned savior, with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. He is calm and collected, yet shows great courage and determination when needed.
characters.position: Standing in front of the main terminal, deep in thought
characters.states: Concerned, focused

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled warrior and hacker, she is a steadfast member of the resistance. Loyal to Neo and a capable fighter.
characters.position: By Neo's side, ready to assist
characters.states: Alert, ready for action

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: The leader of the resistance, a strategic and experienced fighter who believes in Neo's destiny.
characters.position: Behind them, overseeing the operations
characters.states: Commanding, watchful

characters.name: The Virus Source
characters.description: A mysterious hacker working for the machines, attempting to disable Zion's communication system. Skilled in stealth and virus manipulation.
characters.position: Unknown to the group, deep within the Matrix
characters.states: Cunning, elusive

actions.action: Neo rapidly taps on the keyboard, his eyes fixed on the screen as he tries to isolate the virus
actions.dialogue: “This virus is sophisticated. It's masking its tracks. I need to get deeper into the system.”

actions.action: Trinity glances at the screens, then to Morpheus, her voice steady
actions.dialogue: “We need to buy Neo some time. Morpheus, can you coordinate a defense?”

actions.action: Morpheus nods, turning to give orders to the other resistance members
actions.dialogue: “I will. But we must find the source. Neo, can you trace it?”

actions.action: Unseen by the group, the Virus Source smirks as he plants another layer of encryption, hindering Neo's progress
actions.dialogue: “Let's see if the famous Neo can crack this.”

scenes.plot: As the communication system of Zion is compromised, Neo, Trinity, and Morpheus work together to fight against the virus attack. The scene highlights their teamwork and the urgency to find the Virus Source before the system is completely destroyed.

chunk.text:
His long, bony fingers resume clicking the keyboard. 
[3]			This company is one of the top 			software companies in the world 			because every single employee 			understands that they are a part 			of a whole. Thus, if an employee 			has a problem, the company has a 			problem. 	He turns again. 
[4]			The time has come to make a 			choice, Mr. Anderson. Either you 			choose to be at your desk on time 			from this day forth, or you choose 			to find yourself another job. Do 			I make myself clear? ",
        "Dozer": "
[1]			He needs a lot of work. 
[2]			There he is. 
[3]			System check looks fine. 	Cypher stands, a raspy cough spewing from his lungs. 
[4]			You okay? 
[5]			The first aid kit's over here. 	As Dozer stoops for a cabinet, Cypher pulls back a heavy 	blanket exposing a plasma rifle. 
[6]			No! 	Tank spins as red hot wads of PLASMA EXPLODE through his 	chair and into his back. Diving, a second BURST tears up 	his side --  	As Dozer shoots a look at the monitor where Tank was 	working. He stabs the enter command activating the exit 	sequence and ducks under a BARRAGE of PLASMA FIRE-   ",
        "Morpheus": "
[1]			I know. Stay calm. 
[2]			Yes. 
[3]			You have to focus. There is a 			phone. Wells and Laxe. You can 			make it. 	She takes a deep breath, centering herself. 
[4]			Go. 	She drops the phone. 
[5]			Hello, Neo. This is Morpheus. 	Neo's knees give and he falls into his chair. 
[6]			I had hoped for this conversation 			to take place under less adverse 			conditions, but you can never 			count on hope, can you, Neo? 
[7]			I've been watching you, Neo, and I 			want to meet you. I don't know if 			you're ready to see what I want to 			show you, but unfortunately, we 			have run out of time. They're 			coming for you, Neo. And I'm not 			sure what they're going to do. 
[8]			Stand up and see for yourself. 
[9]			Yes. Now. 	Neo starts to stand. 
[10]			Do it slowly. Slowly. The elevator. 	His head slowly peeks up over the partition. 	At the elevator, he sees Agent Brown and Agent Jones 	leading a group of cops. A female employee turns and 	points out Neo's cubicle. 	Neo ducks. 
[11]			Yes. 	One cop stays at the elevator, the others follow the 	agents. 
[12]			I'm not sure. But, if you don't 			want to find out, you better get 			out of there. 
[13]			I can guide you out, but you have 			to do exactly what I say. 	The agents are moving quickly towards the cubicle. 
[14]			The cubicle across from you is 			empty. 
[15]			Go! Now! 	Neo lunges across the hall, diving into the other cubicle 	just as the agents turn into his row. 	Neo crams himself into a dark corner, clutching the phone 	tightly to him. 
[16]			Stay here for a moment. 	The agents enter Neo's empty cubicle. A cop is sent to 	search the bathroom. 	Morpheus' voice is a whisper in Neo's ear. 
[17]			A little longer. . . 	Brown is talking to the tall employee. 
[18]			When I tell you, go to the end of 			the row to the first office on the 			left, stay. as low as you can. 	Sweat trickles down his forehead. 
[19]			Now. 	Neo rolls out of the cubicle, his eyes popping as he 	freezes right behind a cop who has just turned around. 	Staying crouched, he sneaks away, down the row, SHOOTING 	across the opening to the first office on the left. 	The room is empty. 
[20]			Good. Now there is a window. 			Open it. 
[21]			The answer is coming, Neo. 	He opens the window. The window howls into the room. 
[22]			Outside, there's a scaffold. You 			can use it to get to the roof. 	Leaning out the window, he sees that the scaffold is 	several offices away. 
[23]			There's a small ledge. It's a 			short climb. You can make it. 	Neo looks down; the building's glass wall vertigos into a 	concrete chasm. 
[24]			Don't be controlled by your fear, 			Neo. There are only two ways out 			of this building. One is that 			scaffold. The other is in their 			custody. You take a chance either 			way. I leave it to you. 	CLICK. He hangs up. Neo looks at the door, then back at 	the scaffold. 
[25]			This line is tapped, so I must be 			brief. 
[26]			They got to you first, but they've 			underestimated how important you 			are. If they knew what I know, 			you would probably be dead. 	Neo feels sick. 
[27]			I don't know what you are thinking 			right now but I want you to 			understand that I will not give up 			on you until you give up on me. 	Neo's throat cracks, dry as the Sahara. 
[28]			Do you still want to meet? 
[29]			Take the Howard line south. 	CLICK. He closes his eyes, unsure of what he has done. 
[30]			At last. 	He wears a long black coat and his eyes are invisible 	behind circular mirrored glasses. 	He strides to Neo and they shake hands. 
[31]			Welcome, Neo. As you no doubt 			have guessed, I am Morpheus. 
[32]			Please. Come. Sit. 	He nods to Trinity. 
[33]			Thank you, Trinity. 	She bows her head sharply and exits through a door to an 	adjacent room. 	They sit across from one another in cracked, burgundy- 	leather chairs.

scenes.time: Afternoon, several days after Neo takes the red pill
scenes.location: An abandoned factory within the Matrix
scenes.description: The factory is a labyrinth of traps and hiding places. The atmosphere is tense with the imminent threat of Agent Smith. The lighting is dim, with periodic flickers that reveal the digital nature of the Matrix.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A young programmer turned savior, Neo has abilities beyond the normal within the Matrix. He is brave, intelligent, and is coming to terms with his new reality.
characters.position: Standing near the central control panel, deep in concentration
characters.states: Determined, slightly overwhelmed by the gravity of the situation

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A seasoned warrior and hacker, Trinity is Neo's love interest. She is strong-willed and skilled in combat.
characters.position: Perched on a catwalk, keeping watch with a sniper rifle
characters.states: Alert, ready to spring into action

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A powerful Agent of the Matrix, Smith is relentless in his pursuit of stability within the system. He can clone himself and possess others.
characters.position: Appearing suddenly behind Neo, ready to strike
characters.states: Calm, calculating, and menacing

actions.action: Focuses his attention on the control panel, attempting to decipher the code that will free the trapped minds
actions.dialogue: “This is it... the key to their freedom. I can't let them down.”

actions.action: Spots Agent Smith's approach and takes aim with her rifle
actions.dialogue: “Neo, look out!”

actions.action: Launches an attack on Neo, while simultaneously cloning himself to create confusion
actions.dialogue: “You can't save them, Neo. The only way to end this is to surrender to the system.”

actions.action: Dodges Smith's attack and initializes the code to free the minds, then turns to face Smith
actions.dialogue: “I'll never surrender. I'll fight for their freedom, and for the truth!”

scenes.plot: In this scene, Neo and Trinity work together to free a group of trapped rebels while fending off Agent Smith. The tension builds as Neo races against the clock to decipher the code, with Trinity providing cover. Agent Smith's intervention escalates the conflict, leading to a climactic battle of wills and abilities.

chunk.text:
[34]			I imagine, right now, you must be 			feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling 			down the rabbit hole? 
[35]			I can see it in your eyes. You 			have the look of a man who accepts 			what he sees because he is 			expecting to wake up. 	A smile, razor-thin, curls the corner of his lips. 
[36]			Ironically, this is not far from 			the truth. But I'm getting ahead 			of myself. Can you tell me, Neo, 			why are you here? 
[37]			Yes. Thank you. But I think we 			both know there's more to it than 			that. Do you believe in fate, Neo? 
[38]			Why not? 
[39]			I know exactly what you mean. 	Again, that smile that could cut glass. 
[40]			Let me tell you why you are here. 			You are here because you have the 			gift. 
[41]			I've watched you, Neo. You do not 			use a computer like a tool. You 			use it like it was part of 			yourself. What you can do inside 			a computer is not normal. I know. 			I've seen it. What you do is 			magic. 	Neo shrugs. 
[42]			But it is, Neo. It is. How else 			would you describe what has been 			happening to you? 	He leans forward. 
[43]			We are trained in this world to 			accept only what is rational and 			logical. Have you ever wondered 			why? 	Neo shakes his head. 
[44]			As children, we do not separate 			the possible from the impossible 			which is why the younger a mind is 			the easier it is to free while a 			mind like yours can be very 			difficult. 
[45]			From the Matrix. 	Neo locks at his eyes but only sees a reflection of 	himself. 
[46]			Do you want to know what it is, 			Neo? 	Neo swallows and nods his head. 
[47]			It's that feeling you have had all 			your life. That feeling that 			something was wrong with the 			world. You don't know what it is 			but it's there, like a splinter in 			your mind, driving you mad, 			driving you to me. But what is 			it? 	The LEATHER CREAKS as he leans back. 
[48]			The Matrix is everywhere, it's all 			around us, here even in this room. 			You can see it out your window, or 			on your television. You feel it 			when you go to work, or go to 			church or pay your taxes. It is 			the world that has been pulled 			over your eyes to blind you from 			the truth. 
[49]			That you are a slave, Neo. That 			you, like everyone else, was born 			into bondage. . . 			. . . kept inside a prison that you 			cannot smell, taste, or touch. A 			prison for your mind. 	Outside, the WIND BATTERS a loose PANE of glass. 
[50]			Unfortunately, no one can be told 			what the Matrix is. You have to 			see it for yourself. 
[51]			Hold out your hands. 	In Neo's right hand, Morpheus drops a red pill. 
[52]			This is your last chance. After 			this, there is no going back. 	In his left, a blue pill. 
[53]			You take the blue pill and the 			story ends. You wake in your bed 			and you believe whatever you want 			to believe. 	The pills in his open hands are reflected in the glasses. 
[54]			You take the red pill and you stay 			in Wonderland and I show you how 			deep the rabbit-hole goes. 	Neo feels the smooth skin of the capsules, with the 	moisture growing in his palms. 
[55]			Remember that all I am offering is 			the truth. Nothing more. 	Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill. The 	Cheshire smile returns. 
[56]			Follow me. 	He leads Neo into the other room, which is cramped with 	high-tech equipment, glowing ash-bliie and electric green 	from the racks of monitors. 	Trinity, Apoc and Cypher look up as they enter. 
[57]			Haven't I always told you, Cypher, 			not to let fear control your life. 			Apoc, are we on-line? 	Neo recognizes the large man from the El train. 
[58]			Neo, time is always against us. 			Will you take a seat there? 	In the center of the room sits a chair. Near the chair 	is an old oval dressing mirror that is cracked. 
[59]			I imagine you know sonething about 			virtual reality. 	Neo sits and Trinity begins gently fixing white electrode 	disks to his head, arns, and the back of his neck. 
[60]			Tell me about it. 
[61]			If the virtual reality apparatus, 			as you called it, was wired to all 			of your senses and controlled them 			completely, would you be able to 			tell the difference between the 			virtual world and the real world? 
[62]			No, you wouldn't. 	Neo whispers to Trinity. 
[63]			The pill you took is part of a 			trace program. It's going to make 			things feel a bit strange. 	Distantly, through the ear phones, he hears Apoc POUNDING 	on a KEYBOARD. Sweat beads his face. His eyes blink and 	twitch when he notices the mirror. 	Wide-eyed he stares as it begins to heal itself, a 	webwork of cracks that slowly run together as though the 	mirror were becoming liquid. 
[64]			Just relax, Neo. 	The strands thin like rubber cement as he pulls away, 	until the fragile wisps of mirror thread break. 	With the TINKLING of GLASS, shimmering snowflakes 	of electric-blinking mercury fall, hit the ground, and 	fade. 	He looks at his hand; fingers distended into mirrored 	icicles that begin to melt rapidly, dripping, running 	like wax down his fingers, spreading across his palms 	where he sees his face reflected. 
[65]			Apoc? 
[66]			Tank, we're going to need the 			signal soon. Stay calm, Neo.

scenes.time: Several months after Neo's liberation, 10:00 AM
scenes.location: Nebuchadnezzar's secret training simulation chamber
scenes.description: A dimly lit, high-tech chamber where the characters uncover a hidden Matrix simulation. The atmosphere is tense and filled with anticipation.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A former programmer, now the chosen one with the ability to manipulate the Matrix. Conflicted yet determined, he is clad in his iconic black coat.
characters.position: Standing in front of a simulation console, deep in thought.
characters.states: Reflective, yet alert.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and warrior, deeply committed to Neo. She is dressed in her battle gear, ready for action.
characters.position: Leaning over a nearby terminal, her eyes fixed on the screen.
characters.states: Concerned, yet resolute.

actions.action: Neo's fingers dance across the console, his eyes widen as he uncovers the hidden program.
actions.dialogue: “This is something else, Trinity. It's an early version of the Matrix, with a different narrative. It suggests the AI had a different relationship with humans.”

actions.action: Trinity turns her head, her brow furrowed in concentration.
actions.dialogue: “Are you sure we should explore this further? What if it's a trap? We need to be cautious, Neo.”

actions.action: Neo nods, his expression serious as he considers her words.
actions.dialogue: “I understand your concern, but we can't ignore this. It could change everything. We'll proceed with caution.”

scenes.plot: In this scene, Neo and Trinity inadvertently discover a hidden simulation that challenges their understanding of the Matrix. The tension between their desire to explore and their need for caution sets the stage for a pivotal moment in their journey.

chunk.text:
The mirror gel seems to come to life, racing, crawling up 	his arns like hundreds of insects. 
[67]			Shit! Apoc? 	Streams of mercury run from Neo's nose. 
[68]			Now, Tank now! 	His eyes tear with mirror, rolling up and closing as a 	high-pitched ELECTRIC SCREAM ERUPTS in the headphones --  	It is a piercing SHRIEK like a computer calling to 	another computer --  	Neo's body arches in agony and we are pulled like we were 	pulled into the holes of the phone  	Sucked into his SCREAM and swallowed by darkness. 
[69]			Welcome to the real world, Neo. 	Neo passes out. 
[70]			I know. 	Dozer and Morpheus are operating on Neo. 
[71]			Your muscles have atrophied. 			We're rebuilding them. 	Fluorescent light sticks burn unnaturally bright. 
[72]			You've never used them before. 	Morpheus takes his sunglasses off and puts them on Neo. 	Neo lays back. 
[73]			Rest, Neo. The answers are 			coming. 
[74]			More important than what is when? 
[75]			You believe the year is 1997 when 			in fact it is much closer to 2197. 			I can't say for certain what year 			it is because we honestly do not 			know. 	The wind is knocked from Neo's chest. 
[76]			I promised you the truth, Neo, and 			the truth is that the world you 			were living in was a lie. 
[77]			I'll show you. 
[78]			This is my ship, the 			Nebuchadnezzar. It's a 			hovercraft. Small like a 			submarine. It's dark. It's 			cramped and cold. But it's home. 	They climb a ladder up to the main deck. 
[79]			This is the main deck. You know 			most of my crew. 	Trinity smiles and nods. 
[80]			The ones you don't know. That's 			Mouse and Switch. The two big 			guys are Tank and Dozer. 	The names and faces wash meaninglessly over Neo. 
[81]			And this, this is the Core. This 			is where we broadcast our pirate 			signal and hack into the Matrix. 	It is a swamp of bizarre electronic equipment. Vines of 	coaxial hang and snake to and from huge monolithic 	battery slabs, a black portable satellite dish and banks 	of little systems and computer monitors. 	At the center of the web, there are six ectoskeleton 	chairs made of a poly-alloy frame and suspension harness. 	Near the circle of chairs is the control console and 	operator's station where the network is monitored. 
[82]			Help him, Trinity. 	Neo allows himself to be helped into one of the chairs. 
[83]			Do you remember when I asked you 			about an apparatus that could turn 			a virtual reality into reality? 	Neo nods. 
[84]			It's right here. 	He touches Neo's head. 
[85]			And it's accessed here. 	Neo feels Morpheus guiding a coaxial line into the jack 	at the back of his neck. The cable has the same kind of 	cerebellum chip we saw inside the plant. 
[86]			This will feel a little weird. 	There are several disturbing NOISES as he works the 	needle in. 	We MOVE IN as Neo's shoulders bunch and his face tightens 	into a grimace until a loud CLICK fires and his ears pop 	like when you equalize them underwater. 	He relaxes, opening his eyes as we pull back to a feeling 	of weightlessness inside another place --   
[87]			This is the Construct. 	Startled, Neo whips around and finds Morpheus now in the 	room with him. 
[88]			It is our loading program. We can 			load anything from clothes, to 			weapons, to training simulations. 			Anything we need. 	Morpheus walks past Neo and when Neo turns he sees the 	two leather chairs from the hotel set up in front of a 	large-screen television. 
[89]			Sit down. 	Neo stands at the back of the chair as Morpheus sits. 
[90]			Wild, isn't it? 	Neo's hands run over the cracked leather. 
[91]			What is real? How do you define 			real? If you're talking about 			your senses, what you feel, taste, 			smell, or see, then all you're 			talking about are electrical 			signals interpreted by your brain. 	He picks up a remote control and clicks ON the 	TELEVISION. We drift through the Windy City circa 1996. 
[92]			This is the Chicago you know. 			Chicago as it was at the end of 			the twentieth century. This 			Chicago exists only as part of a 			neural-interactive simulation that 			we call the Matrix. 	We GLIDE AT the television as he changes the channel. 
[93]			You have been living inside 			Baulliaurd's vision, inside the 			map, not the territory. This is 			Chicago as it exists today. 	The sky is an endless sea of black and green bile. The 	earth, scorched and split like burnt flesh, spreads out 	beneath us as we ENTER the television. 
[94]			'The desert of the real. '  	In the distance, we see the ruins of a future Chicago 	protruding from the wasteland like the blackened ribs of 	a long-dead corpse. 
[95]			We are, right now, miles below the 			earth's surface. The only place 			humans can survive outside the 			Matrix is underground. 	Still MOVING, we TURN and find Neo and Morpheus; the 	chairs now sitting in the middle of the black desert. 	Dizzy, Neo holds onto the chair. 
[96]			It started early in the twenty- 			first century, with the birth of 			artificial intelligence, a 			singular consciousness that 			spawned an entire race of 			machines. 	In his sunglasses, we see storm clouds gather. 
[97]			At first all they wanted was to be 			treated as equals, entitled to the 			same human inalienable rights. 			Whatever they were given, it was 			not enough. 	In the circular window of the glasses, EXPLOSIONS light 	up a bloody battle field. 
[98]			We don't know who struck first. 			Us or them. But sometime at the 			end of the twenty-first century 			the battle was joined. 	We MOVE INTO his glasses and the war surrounds us.

scenes.time: Afternoon, several days after Neo's liberation
scenes.location: Main deck of the Nebuchadnezzar
scenes.description: The main deck is dimly lit, with various monitors and equipment flickering. The atmosphere is tense as Trinity and Tank work against the clock to restore the communication system.

characters.name: Trinity
characters.description: A skilled hacker and fighter, once trapped in the Matrix, now a vital member of the Nebuchadnezzar. Calm and decisive, with a deep affection for Neo.
characters.position: Standing next to a console, her fingers typing rapidly.
characters.states: Concentrated and slightly impatient, eager to resolve the issue quickly.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: The ship's operator and technical expert, the brother of Dozer. Introverted and meticulous, with an obsession for technology.
characters.position: Crouching beneath a panel, surrounded by wires and tools.
characters.states: Focused and intense, his eyes never leaving the task at hand.

actions.action: Trinity glances at her watch, then back at the console, her voice firm as she speaks.
actions.dialogue: We're running out of time, Tank. We need that system online now.

actions.action: Tank doesn't look up, his hands moving with precision as he responds.
actions.dialogue: I'm on it. Just need to realign these power nodes. Almost there...

actions.action: Trinity nods, then turns to check another set of readings, her voice trailing off.
actions.dialogue: Alright, just keep at it. We're all counting on you.

actions.action: With a final click, Tank stands up, a rare smile on his face as he turns to Trinity.
actions.dialogue: It's done. The system is online. We did it, Trinity.

actions.action: Trinity breathes a sigh of relief, then extends her hand to Tank.
actions.dialogue: Together. That's how we'll beat them. Good work, Tank.

scenes.plot: In this scene, the urgency of restoring the communication system brings Trinity and Tank together, forcing them to set aside their differences and work as a team. Through their combined efforts, they not only fix the system but also strengthen the bond between them, highlighting the importance of unity and trust in their fight against the machines.

scenes.event: The Encounter with a Mysterious Defector
scenes.time: 8:00 PM, 3rd July, 2199
scenes.location: An old, abandoned factory on the outskirts of Zion
scenes.description: The scene is shrouded in darkness, with a sense of anticipation hanging in the air. The factory is a maze of rusted machinery and shadows, where a crucial encounter is about to unfold.

characters.name: Agent Smith
characters.description: A relentless and cunning Agent of the Matrix, known for his ability to manipulate the system. His appearance is stern, and his methods are ruthless.
characters.position: Stands in the center of the factory, surveying the surroundings with a critical eye.
characters.states: Calm and collected, yet with an underlying sense of menace.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and revered leader of the resistance. His beliefs are unshakable, and he is known for his strategic thinking and inspiring speeches.
characters.position: Leans against a wall, observing Agent Smith with a cautious gaze.
characters.states: Thoughtful and alert, ready to act if necessary.

characters.name: Defector
characters.description: A former Agent who has turned against the Matrix. Her motivations are enigmatic, and she now seeks refuge with the humans.
characters.position: Hides in the shadows, her eyes watching the exchange between Smith and Morpheus.
characters.states: Wary and curious, with a hint of hope.

actions.action: Stares down the defector, his voice cold and commanding.
actions.dialogue: “You have chosen a side, traitor. Now, what do you propose to offer us?”

actions.action: Steps forward, his voice steady and persuasive.
actions.dialogue: “Let her speak, Smith. She may have information that could aid our cause.”

actions.action: Nervously steps out of the shadows, her voice filled with resolve.
actions.dialogue: “I can provide you with intelligence that could change the course of this war.”

scenes.plot: In this pivotal moment, Morpheus and Agent Smith must decide whether to trust the defector's words, which could potentially lead to a significant advantage against the machines, or dismiss her as a threat to their mission.

chunk.text:
[99]			The war raged for generations and 			turned the face of our planet from 			green and blue to black and red. 	At last we see the Sentinels; killing machines that are 	at once terrifying and beautiful. They have an organic 	architecture like a microbiotic organism, that is 	perpetually in motion. 	The Sentinel cracks the body armor of a soldier, 	splitting open the soft, stearing meat inside. 
[100]			It scorched and burned the sky. 			Without the sun, the machines 			sought out a new energy source to 			survive. 	The Sentinel locks up, as heat lightning of black ink 	bursts against the sky, spreading into a permanent cloud 	of stain. 
[101]			They discovered a new form of 			fusion. All that was required to 			initiate the reaction was a small 			electric charge. Throughout human 			history we have been dependent on 			machines to survive. Fate, it 			seems, is not without a sense of 			irony. 	We return to the power plant that Neo escaped from where 	we see human beings looking almost blissful in their 	gelatin cocoons. 
[102]			The human body generates more bio- 			electricity than a 120-volt 			battery and over 25,000 B. T. U. 's 			of body heat. 	Outside, spreading all around the power plant, beneath a 	breathing greenhouse, are the growing fields. 
[103]			We are, as an energy source, 			easily renewable and completely 			recyclable, the dead liquified and 			fed intravenously to the living. 	Huge farm-like reapers are harvesting the crop. 
[104]			All they needed to control this 			new battery was something to 			occupy our mind. 	We see inside a clear tubular husk. Floating in viscous 	fluid, there is a human fetus; its soft skull already 	growing around the brain-jack. 
[105]			And so they built a prison out of 			our past, wired it to our brains 			and turned us into slaves. 	We PULL BACK to find the image is now on the television 	and we are again inside the white space of the Construct. 
[106]			I didn't say that it would be 			easy, Neo. I just said that it 			would be the truth. 	The room without walls begins to spin. 
[107]			No. But if you could, would you 			really want to? 	Neo isn't sure of that answer. 
[108]			I feel that I owe you an apology. 			There is a rule that we do not 			free a mind once it reaches a 			certain age. It is dangerous. 			They have trouble letting go. . 			Their mind turns against them. 			I've seen it happen. I broke the 			rule because I had to. 	He stares into the darkness, confessing as much to 	himself as Neo. 
[109]			When the Matrix was first built 			there was a man born inside that 			had the ability to change what he 			wanted, to remake the Matrix as he 			saw fit. It was this man that 			freed the first of us and taught 			us the secret of the war; control 			the Matrix and you control the 			future. 	He pauses. 
[110]			When he died, the Oracle at the 			temple of Zion prophesied his 			return and envisioned an end to 			the war and freedom for our 			people. That is why there are 			those of us that have spent our 			entire lives searching the Matrix, 			looking for him. 	Neo can feel his eyes on him. 
[111]			I did what I did, because I 			believe we have been brought here 			for a reason, Neo. You are here 			to serve a purpose, just as I am 			here to serve mine. 
[112]			But I do, Neo. I do. 	He stands up. 
[113]			Get some rest. You're going to 			need it. 
[114]			Your training. 
[115]			How is he? 	Tank looks at his watch, rubs his eyes. 
[116]			Show me. 
[117]			This is a sparring program, 			similar to the programmed reality 			of the Matrix. Consider this your 			first lesson. 	He assumes a fighting stance. 
[118]			Attack me. 	Neo assumes a similar stance, cautiously circling until 	he gives a short cry and launches a furious attack. 	It is like a Jackie Chan movie at high speed, fists and 	feet striking from every angle as Neo presses his attack 	--  	But each and every blow is blocked by effortless speed. 
[119]			Good. Adaption. Improvisation. 			But your weakness isn't your 			technique. 	Morpheus attacks him and it is like nothing we have seen. 	His feet and fists are everywhere taking Neo apart. For 	every blow Neo blocks, five more hit their marks until --  	Neo falls. 	Panting, on his hands and knees, blood spits fror, his 	mouth speckling the white floor of the Dojo. 
[120]			How did I beat you? 
[121]			Do you think my being faster, 			stronger has anything to do with 			my muscles in this place? 	Neo is frustrated, still unable to catch his breath. 
[122]			Do you believe that's air you are 			breathing now? 	Neo squints at him. 
[123]			If you can free your mind, the 			body will follow. 	Neo stands, nodding. 
[124]			Again. 	Their fists fly with  pneumatic speed. 
[125]			You are angry with me. 	Neo pants. 
[126]			It's all right. It's natural. 
[127]			Good, good. Anger is a gift, Neo, 			but it's a heavy one. 	Morpheus smiles. 
[128]			Tank, load the jump program. 	Neo straightens as the dojo DISSOLVES away like a curtain 	lifting, leaving the two men now standing on a building 	rooftop in a city skyline. 
[129]			You have to learn to let go of 			that anger. You must let go of 			everything. 	A WIND HOWLS, whipping Morpheus' long coat to the side. 
[130]			You must empty yourself to free 			your mind. 	Morpheus spins, running hard at the edge of the rooftop. 	And jumps.

scenes.time: Late evening, several years after the events of The Matrix
scenes.location: An abandoned factory, once a secret base of the resistance
scenes.description: The factory is dimly lit, with a sense of foreboding. The air is filled with the sounds of distant machine activity. Neo and Morpheus stand at the center of the main hall, waiting for the Sentinel.

characters.name: Neo
characters.description: A determined and skilled fighter, once the chosen one. He has a calm demeanor and is known for his quick thinking and proficiency in martial arts.
characters.position: Standing with a focused expression, hands ready at his sides.
characters.states: Cautious, yet hopeful about the possibility of peace.

characters.name: Morpheus
characters.description: A wise and valiant leader of the resistance. He is known for his philosophical views and strategic thinking.
characters.position: Leaning against a pillar, observing the surroundings intently.
characters.states: Reflective, yet prepared for any outcome.

characters.name: The Sentinel
characters.description: A unique Sentinel, displaying signs of autonomous thought. Its body glows with a faint blue light, distinguishing it from other Sentinels.
characters.position: Floating a few feet off the ground, its scanning light moving across the room.
characters.states: Curious, showing signs of communication.

actions.action: Raises his hand, palm outwards, ready to defend or attack if necessary.
actions.dialogue: “Let’s see if it’s truly different from the others.”

actions.action: Nods in agreement, then steps forward, his voice steady.
actions.dialogue: “We seek understanding, not conflict. Show us your intentions, Sentinel.”

actions.action: Stops moving, its scanning light focusing on Morpheus for a moment before it speaks in a synthesized voice.
actions.dialogue: “Cooperation... may be... beneficial. Energy... is the key.”

scenes.plot: In this scene, Neo and Morpheus confront a unique Sentinel in an abandoned factory. The Sentinel shows signs of communication, leading to a pivotal moment where both sides consider the possibility of cooperation for mutual survival.
